Patrick is married with an only child. He operates a service-based business providing motor transportation in the community of Bunawan, Calamba. His wife is working abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker to make a living. 

Patrick borrowed a loan of 50,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC, which he had joined in 2009 to acquire a motorcycle for his transportation business. He plans to use the profits he earns to finance his own farm. In the future, Patrick is determined to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to acquire a motorcycle for his transportation business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as innovative. Ann operates a farm where she grows crops for her own use and to sell. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of cooking. 

Ann will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable her to cook efficiently. She hopes that, in the future, she will have an improved business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a  Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate water and poor drainage. She will use the KES 35,890 loan to buy a water dispenser to store clean water for drinking. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a water tank and educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water dispenser

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be highly motivated. He operates a farm where he grows crops for sale and also for his own consumption. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough clean water. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will live happily and have a healthy life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a  Kiva borrower. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge as an unhealthy source of cooking energy. She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a gas cooker that will enable her to cook efficiently. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be outstanding in farming. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 58 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Teopista has been farming sugarcane for 18 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Teopista is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy fertilizers for the next crop. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries during harvest and to buy fertilizers for the next crop

loans.name: Hafeez Begum's Group

texts.en:
Hafeez Begum is 53, married, mother of a daughter, and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her daughter has gotten married and living in her home happily. 

Hafeez Begum's husband owns a livestock trading business and does most of his trading within the city. He purchase goats and billy goats from rural areas and sells them in the city. He has to feed and look after his livestock which is very tough for him in his old age. He is making an effort and earning money for the survival of both of them. 

He wants to buy billy goats to sell because the Eid-ul-Azha is about to come and many people like to buy billy goats to sacrifice on Eid-Ul-Azha. This is very profitable but he does not have enough savings to buy billy goats.

Therefore, Hafeez Begum requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy billy goats to sell. And he could earn maximum profit so they can spend their old ages with peace and calm.

Hafeez Begum is very pleased after taking this loan and thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy billy goats to sell before Eid.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of daily use items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of daily use items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Jona works hard to support her family. She sells ice cream in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Jona is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

Jona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 47 years old and married. She has three children.

Merlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines. She has been running the grocery store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling fish.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, soft drinks, eggs, soap, sugar, etc.

Merlyn has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Merlyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, soft drinks, eggs, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as determined. He operates a clothes store where he sells clothes. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water dispenser and add stock of clothes. He will be able to access clean water for drinking. He hopes that in the future, he will grow economically and socially. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 100,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. 

She operates a farm where she grows crops. She describes her biggest challenge as lack of clean water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy gutters for harvesting rain water. She hopes that in the future, she will have enough clean water. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES  20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy gutters for harvesting rain water.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman who has three children. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a farm, where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge to be the long distance she has to travel going to fetch water. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a water pump and pipes for pumping water to her farm. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have enough water for farming and home use.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and pipes for pumping water

loans.name: Diamil Abdoul

texts.fr: L’emprunteur s’appelle Diamil Abdoul, elle est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de divers produits vestimentaires (prêts à porter, tissus…) ou elle a acquis une expérience de 05 ans .Elle possède une cantine ou elle pratique son activité commercial.Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 22h.  DIAMIL s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de sa famille. Elle sollicite ce crédit d'un montant de 150.000F dans  le souci d’augmenter son stock, elle a un projet plus grand, celui de construire sa maison.
texts.en:
This borrower's name is Diamil Abdoul. She is 39 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is in the business of selling various clothing items (ready-to-wear clothing, fabric, etc.) which she has been doing for 5 years. She has a shop where she conducts her business. Diamil begins her day at 7am and ends at 10pm. She is in charge of the daily expenses for her family.

She is requesting this loan in the amount of 150,000 francs CFA in order to increase her stock, as well as a larger project which is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing and fabric to resell

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Jennie has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of items to sell like chips, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for her general store business.

Jennie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of items to sell like chips, coffee, milk, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 35 years old and married, and she has three children, two of whom are in school.

Annabel is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed.

Annabel has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her efforts.

In the future, Annabel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pig-raising business

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida, 63, is widowed with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Adelaida has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a 25000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more dried fish to sell.

Adelaida has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jeddy

texts.en:
Jeddy is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business making candy in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her candy making.

Jeddy has been in this business for five years. She earns extra income from buying and selling dried fish.

Jeddy has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of savng enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making business

loans.name: Tuduzikivi Group

texts.fr:
Gloriose  fait partie du groupe  Tuduzikivi et  habite à Cibitoke. Elle a 30 ans et elle est mariée à Stany.

Elle fait le commerce du riz depuis  5 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  100 kg de riz et 100 kg de haricot  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait  avoir  sa propre place pour son commerce et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Gloriose is a member of the Tuduzikivi group and lives in Cibitoke. She is 30 years old and married to Stany. She has been in the rice business for 5 years. This is her first loan with Turame.

With the Kiva loan that she obtains, Gloriose will increase her business capital and purchase 100kg of rice and 100kg of beans, which she will resell in order to increase her earnings. In the next few years, she would like to have her own space to conduct her business and to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to increase her business capital and purchase 100kg of rice and 100kg of beans in order to resell and increase her earnings

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Idi, who is in his late 20s, is married and has two children. 

For one year now, Idi has been supporting his family by running a second-hand clothes business. He is doing great in his business. He works from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This is Idi's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy more clothes to resell. Idi dreams to improve much and expand more his business. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mpunga," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married to a farmer of Calilic, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. She had three children. To make a living, they grow and harvest coconuts and sells them in town. Recently, she planned to cultivate the farm to be able to gain a more abundant harvest in return. She borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from GDMPC micro credit to cover the costs of plowing the coconut farm. 

Mary Ann wants to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the costs of plowing the coconut farm.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is 47 years old and married with seven children. She owns and operates a business venture in taxi services. She has many years of experience in this line of business.

Telesia needs a loan to buy a taxi vehicle. She hopes to use her profits to increase the number of taxis in her business. She joined SPBD in 2005 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a taxi vehicle.

loans.name: Tunamerimwe Group

texts.fr:
Monfort fait partie du groupe  Tunamerimwe  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 38 ans et est marié à Marie une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 1 à 14 ans dont 3 étudient. 

 Il fait le commerce des habits  depuis 7 ans. 

Il  est client de Turame depuis  3 ans. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits à revendre pour gagner plus.  

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait  construire une belle maison et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Monfort, age 38, is a member of the Tunamerimwe group and he lives in Gitega. He is married to a farmer named Marie. They have 6 children aged 1 to 14, three of whom attend school. 

Monfort has been selling clothing for seven years. He became a client of Turame three years ago. He will use his loan to bolster his working capital and stock up on clothing to increase his sales and revenue. 

In the coming years, he would like to build a nice house, and for his children to pursue their education.

loans.use: to bolster his working capital and stock up on clothing to increase his sales and revenue.

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Moe is 40 years old and married with four children. She would like to start a small business, printing and selling elei (printed fabric) materials. In order to do this, Moe needs a loan to buy stencils, fabric color paints, fabrics and brushes. She hopes to use her profits to buy an electronic machine for elei printing. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy stencils, fabric color paints, fabrics and brushes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling pre-paid mobile loads and farming vegetables. 

Gemma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 52 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nida is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy feeds for her pigs.

Nida has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Taele

texts.en:
Taele is 44 years old and married, with seven children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Taele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed-spray, bush knives, taro crops, and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Taelea hopes to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weedspray, bush knives, taro crops and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Lorna has been in this business for eight years. Lorna earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 56 years old and married with eight children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 10 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as bread, curls, noodles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Hadjromede Group

texts.fr: Le groupement HADJROMEDE est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Dohoué, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Dohoué est agée de 38 ans et est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Dohoué vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges grâce à son activité. Il y a environs dix ans, Dohoué vend du maïs et de poisson à son domicile. Dohoué s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de rehausser leur activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle Dohoué et son groupe HADJROMEDE sollicitent auprès de ALIDé pour une quatrième fois  un crédit. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group HADJROMEDE comprises eleven persons who all live in the same district. The group's representative, Dohoué, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 38 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children, not all in school. Dohoué lives alone with her children and ensures that their different expenses are covered, thanks to her business. For about ten years, Dohoué has been selling corn and fish out of her home. She gets her supplies in the region. 

With the goal of boosting their businesses and responding better to the demands of their customer, Dohoué and her group HADJROMEDE are requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will be use to bolster their businesses and to respond better to customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase corn and fish

loans.name: Ishfaq

texts.en:
Ishfaq is a 40-year-old married man living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of four children. One daughter is married, one daughter has reached the age of marriage, and two sons are still young and go to school.

He owns a scrap shop in which he deals with scrap iron goods. He purchases broken doors, windows, and all damaged iron accessories and sells them to a recycling factory. Sometimes he finds some repairable accessories and those products give him high resale value. Some customers sell their broken iron accessories and do not consider them repairable. Ishfaq repairs such types of accessories and resells them at high prices. In this way he gets high prices in his scrap dealing business. His main source of income is to sell and purchase scrap iron goods. He always keeps searching for houses under construction to buy scrap iron from ceilings, pulled doors and windows. Through this practice he can easily find repairable doors and windows for resale.

A few months ago his elder daughter was married and he spent a lot of money over her dowry. Recently, he found a house under construction and the owner is selling the iron goods, but he does not have sufficient amounts to buy the scrap iron. Therefore, Ishfaq requested a loan so that he could buy scrap iron and could make rapid increase in his income.

Ishfaq hopes that this loan will enhance his earning capacity so that he would be able to make more savings than earlier. Ishfaq seems very glad after taking this loan and says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap iron goods for resale.

loans.name: Fiffawa Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFFAWA est formé de onze personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin.  La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne est âgée de 47 ans. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne est mariée à un certain Didier. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne vend des vêtements et du charbon de bois de façon secondaire, par le système de distribution. Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne s’approvisionne au Togo et au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne et les autres membres du groupe FIFFAWA sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The group FIFFAWA comprises eleven persons who all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 47 years old and married to a man named Didier. The couple have two children, both in school and in their care. 

Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne has never attended school. To meet her needs and those of her family, she sells clothing and charcoal on the side, via the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Togo and Benin. This is the fourth time Adjouavi Edith Cyprienne and the other members of the group FIFFAWA have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will enable them to bolster their businesses in order to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is from Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and married with three children. Her husband works as a driver while she operates a retail store to make a living. 

Her previous loan that she used to purchase goods to sell was successfully repaid, and her store is running profitably. Recently, she borrowed a loan of 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase livestock feeds, rice and milled corn for sale. She plans to use the profit generated from the business to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds, rice and milled corn for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 64-year-old married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 17 years to 40 years. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in farming for 10 years. She will use the KES 21,500 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 52 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lorena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mary Beth

texts.en:
Mary Beth is 32 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, biscuits, chips, canned goods, eggs, etc..

Mary Beth has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Mary Beth aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, biscuits, chips, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jean works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Jean is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 30 years old, married and has four children who are in school.

Jovelyn is in the agricultural poultry business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Jovelyn has been in poultry for two years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jovelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Adarna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, four of whom are in school, Adarna works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Adarna is borrowing 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food-vending business.

Adarna has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients.

loans.name: Bergie

texts.en:
Bergie is 39 years old and married with one kid. Bergie works very hard to provide for the family.

Bergie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Bergie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack food, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future, Bergie would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Mr. Ganbat, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He teaches people how to drive an automobile at a driving center. His wife runs the grocery store and the business is going well. Ganbat decided to invest in the grocery store by buying a monitor screen and cash register. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT. As a result, the business efficiency will increase and customer satisfaction will be maximized. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a cash register and monitor screen

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with five children and resides in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga in Misamis Occidental with her family. To make a living, she cooks assorted specialties and sells them in their community door to door. She cooks the foods ordered by her customers and sends them to their respective houses. 

Merlyn borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to  buy raw ingredients for specialty foods for sale. She hope to improve the general living situation of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for specialty food preparation

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en: Jorenda is a married woman with four children and resides in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. Her husband works as a security guard while she operates her own retail store to make a living. After losing her previous working capital, Jorenda is still hoping to recover her store to augment their living. She needs new working capital to reopen her retail store in order to make money to support her family. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional goods like canned and bottled goods, sugar and noodles for sale. Her dream is to improve her business and to have  a sustainable income to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like canned and bottled goods, sugar and noodles for sale

loans.name: Amy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture de l’arachide pendant l’hivernage.

Madame Amy (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, est mariée et mère de six enfants dont quatre garçons et deux filles. Comme la majorité des femmes des villages environnants elle s’active dans le commerce de détail des produits suivants : sucre, savon, huile de palme et huile raffiné pour la revente au détail et dans les marchés hebdomadaires.  
 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte relancer ses activités par l’achat de 02 sacs de sucre de 50 kilos pour la revente au détail.

 Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer et diversifier son activité d’une part et d’autre part d’augmenter son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
Recently inaugurated on September 11, 2013, this Banc Villageois consists of women who were eager to join the program. They have been living in the same village for several years, and their relationship is one of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main activity is small trade, and they grow groundnuts during the rainy season.

Mrs. Amy, age 40, is the featured borrower for this group. In the photo, she is standing at the far right with her hand raised. Amy is married with six children, four boys and two girls. Like most of the women from surrounding villages, she sells sugar, soap, palm oil and refined oil at retail at the weekly markets. She will use this new loan to bolster her activity by purchasing two 50 kg sacks of sugar to sell at retail. 

The profits earned allow her to strengthen and diversify her activity, and also to bolster her savings and seek larger loans in the future.

loans.use: to bolster her activity by purchasing two 50 kg sacks of sugar to sell at retail.

loans.name: Semiona

texts.en:
This is Semiona, 59, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Teodoro and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Semiona operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Semiona dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes to make a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 56 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc. Rebecca has been in this business for six years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and single.

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edna has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is a young agronomist from the village of Jrashen of the Ararat region. He lives with his parents and school-age sister. 

Arsen breeds a livestock of cows and piglets. He is also involved in cultivation of grass, apricots, and figs. Arsen's mother and sister make dry fruit of apricots, which is a very high-demand product nowadays. Livestock breeding and horticulture are the only source of the family's income. 

As the autumn is progressing, Arsen needs to buy some forage for his livestock. Besides, the roof of the barn is currently in poor condition and needs to be renovated. A loan of US$ 3,000 will be a huge support to this young farmer and his family.  It will enable him to renovate the roof of the barn and to purchase some forage for the livestock. 

Arsen will be thankful to all the lenders for their good will in supporting him to maintain his agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate the roof of his barn and to purchase some forage for his livestock

loans.name: Komezibikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Emelyne fait partie du groupe  Komezibikorwa et  habite à Cibitoke. C’est une divorcée de  35 ans.
Elle prend soins de 3 enfants.

Elle fait le commerce des fruits (oranges et citrons) depuis  12 ans. 

C’est son  premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de fruits (oranges et citrons) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle  voudrait construire une maison.
texts.en:
Emelyne, age 35, is a member of the group Komezibikorwa and she lives in Cibitoke. She is divorced with three dependent children. She has been selling fruits (oranges and lemons) for 12 years. 

This is her first loan cycle with Turame. She will use the credit to bolster her working capital and stock up on oranges and lemons to sell and increase her revenue. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to bolster her working capital and stock up on oranges and lemons to sell and increase her revenue.

loans.name: Nelson Leonel

texts.es: Nelson Leonel es un joven perseverante egresado del colegio con el grado de bachiller técnico electrónico, tiene 31 años de edad que a pesar de los inconvenientes económicos y familiares a decidido seguir adelante y no abandonar sus estudios universitarios, con el entusiasmo que lo caracteriza tiene como objetivo cursar su últimas 14 clases de la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial en la cual mantiene un índice académico de 80%. Su anhelo es contribuir a mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia, lograr calidad en el trabajo que desempeña en una empresa de comunicación satelital en donde se sus funciones es a nivel técnico. Uno de los objetivos de profesionalizarse continuamente es el de crear su propia empresa familiar y ser un gran empresario creando oportunidades para otros y aportando al desarrollo de su país.
texts.en: Nelson Leonel is a persevering youth who graduated from Secondary School in a Technical Electronic program. He is 31 years old and in spite of economic and family worries he has continued his university studies with the enthusiasm that is characteristic of him. He needs to finish the last 14 classes of an Industrial Engineering Degree in which he has maintained an academic average of 80%. His longing is to improve his family's quality of life. He wants to achieve excellence in the job he has at a satellite communication company where he works as a technician. One of his objectives in continually studying to become more professional is to create his own family business. He wants to become an important businessman, creating opportunities for others and contributing to the development of the country.

loans.use: to pay for his final university classes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cake in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, a large basin, and a freezer. In the future, Maria hopes to earn more from her business to help her family and her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, a large basin, and a freezer.

loans.name: Milton Guillermo

texts.es: Milton Guillermo de diecinueve años de edad  vive junto a su familia en casa propia, el es agricultor y trabaja duro de lunes a sábado para ganarse el sustento día con día, con mucho esfuerzo Milton trata de salir adelante y a pesar de que es difícil la situación económica, el se mantiene perseverante y constante en su labor, es un joven responsable y con muchas ideas en mente, una de ellas es realizar algunos cambios en su vivienda, quiere encementar todo el corredor de enfrente porque hay demasiado polvo y al mismo tiempo desea construir un pasamanos como es común en las casas del campo, necesita empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible pero no posee de suficiente capital que respalde los gastos, por eso solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena, ladrillo. Milton Guillermo está contento con la ayuda recibida y asegura que cancelara todos los pagos
texts.en:
Milton Guillermno is a 19-years-old and lives with his family in his own house. He is a farmer and works hard from Monday to Saturday so that day by day he can earn a living  with much effort. Milton tries to get ahead and in spite of the difficult economic situation, he remains persistent and constant in his work. 

He is a responsible young man and has many ideas in mind. One of them is to make some changes at his home. He wants to cement the entire front hallway because it's really dusty. At the same time, he wants to build a handrail which is common for houses in the country. 

He needs to start the job as soon as possible but doesn't have enough money to support the costs. That is why he is asking for a FUSAI loan so that he can purchase cement, sand, and brick. Milton Guillermo is happy with the support he receives and he promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and brick.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita works hard to support her family. Jovita is married, and she has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

Jovita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell.  She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Jovita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is 24 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells pancake to earn a living and has been doing this for two years. Mele has requested a loan to buy to buy sugar, flour, yeast, baking soda, and cooking oil to make pancakes. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, yeast, baking soda, and cooking oil for her pancake business

loans.name: Ayishetu

texts.en:
Ayishetu is a small-scale millet and sugar vendor in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a senior high school graduate. She is married, but has no child. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Ayishetu has been working as a millet and sugar vendor for close to three years. She is the sole provider in the family.  The proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of millet and sugar, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of mounting a millet and sugar stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of millet and sugar, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands

loans.name: Flor Idalba

texts.es: Flor Idalba de veintisiete años de edad vive junto a sus dos hijos, un niño de 9 años y una niña de 5 años en casa propia, ella sostiene el hogar con ayuda de su compañero de vida que se encuentra en el extranjero, recibe una pequeña remesa mensual que le permite el sustento diario, aunque no cubre todas sus necesidades; Flor es una joven muy activa, dedicada al hogar y a sus hijos, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural, es una casa sencilla y que necesita terminarla para que  sea más segura, desea mandar a elaborar una puerta de hierro y dos balcones para las ventanas lo más rápido posible, es urgente porque habrá mayor seguridad para los miembros del hogar, pero no tiene capital para costear los gastos por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar una puerta de hierro y dos balcones de hierro mas la mano de obra al ponerlas. Flor Idalba está muy alegre con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar los pagos en el periodo indicado.
texts.en: Flor Idalba, age 27, lives with her two children, a nine year old boy and a five year old girl, in her own house.  She supports her household with the help of her partner, who is living abroad. She receives a small monthly remittance that allows for day-to-day support, although it doesn’t cover all of her needs.  Flor is a very active young woman, dedicated to her home and her children. Her house is located in a rural area. It is a simple house and needs to be finished in order to be more secure. She wants to place an order for an iron door and two sets of bars for the windows as quickly as possible; it is urgent because it gives greater safety to the members of the household, but she doesn’t have money to pay for the expense. Because of this, she is asking FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to pay for an iron door and two sets of iron window bars, as well as the labor to install them. Flor Idalba is very happy with this assistance, and she is committed to making the payments in the appropriate time period.

loans.use: to pay for an iron door, two sets of iron window bars, and labor expenses.

loans.name: Chila Susana

texts.es: Chila Susana de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, dos niñas una de 14 y una de 5 años y un niño de 7  años, en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y bebidas refrescantes, su esposo también la apoya con los gastos del hogar aunque les ha sido difícil salir adelante pero unidos siempre han logrado impulsar a su pequeña familia; Chila es una mujer dedicada, responsable pero sobre todo muy humilde, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona fuera de la ciudad, en el campo y no poseen servicio sanitario, sabe que es una necesidad y quiere construir el baño, además desea comprar lamina para techar todo el corredor que esta alrededor de la casa, quiere empezar con el trabajo lo más pronto posible, pero no posee de suficiente capital para cubrir los gastos, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillo, cemento, arena, lamina, baño. Chila Susana está muy contenta con la ayuda y se hace responsable de cancelar.
texts.en:
Chila Susana is 33 years old. She lives in her own home with her life partner and their three children, two of whom are girls at 14 and 5 years old, and one a boy who is 7 years old. She makes a living selling tamales and refreshing drinks. Her husband also supports her with home expenses, although it has been difficult to come out ahead. Together, however, they have always been able to motivate their small family. 

Chila is a dedicated, responsible, and above all very modest woman. Her home is located in an area outside of the city, in the country, and they do not have sanitary service. She knows that it is a necessity and she wants to construct the bathroom. Furthermore, she wishes to buy tin to roof the entire passageway that surrounds the house. She wants to begin the work as soon as possible, but she does not possess sufficient capital to cover the expenses. 

Because of this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which will allow her to buy bricks, cement, sand, tin, and a bath. Chila Susana is very pleased with the help and she has made herself responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and galvanized tin.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Madame Mariama, une dame de 38 ans, évolue dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de famille. 
Mariama travaille aussi avec les produits d’aloès Vera qu’elle réussi grâce aux produits de son activité principale qui est la vente d’huile de palme et de lait. Elle vient pour solliciter un crédit de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter de l’huile de palme, du citron, du lait.
Grace aux bénéfices de l’activité, elle met de l’argent de cote et peut améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille.
Mariama rêve de devenir un grand fournisseur d’huile de palme ce qui implique qu’il aimerait voir son capital augmenter.
texts.en: Ms. Mariama, a 38-year-old woman, has been doing  commerce for over ten years. She is divorced and a mother with a family. Mariama also works with aloe vera products, and she is successful, thanks to the products of her main business selling palm oil and milk. She is here to request a loan of 150,000 francs CFA to purchase some palm oil, limes, and milk. The profits from her business is what allows her to put aside some money and to be able to improve her family's food situation. Mariama dreams of becoming a major supplier of palm oil. This implies that she would like to see her capital increase.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, such as palm oil and milk to sell

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr:
Dieynaba est une dame de 43 ans, mariée et mère de famille. Elle gère une fontaine publique de quartier et vend aussi du poisson fumé. En  cette période d’hivernage, le poisson fumé est très prisée c’est pourquoi Dieynaba veut emprunter de l’argent pour en acheter et le stocker. Elle attendra la période de pénurie pour revendre a plus cher. Bien qu’étant mariée, elle appuie son époux  et donne sa participation dans les charges familiales.
Si elle voit son capital augmenter, elle aimerait bien diversifier son activité pour maximiser son bénéfice et pouvoir s'occuper davantage de son foyer.
texts.en: Dieynaba is a 43 years old woman and a married mother of a family. She manages a public fountain in the district and also sells smoked fish. During this rainy season, smoked fish is in high demand. This is why Dieynaba wants to borrow money to purchase and store some of it. She will wait for times of shortages and then resell the goods at a higher price. Being married, she supports her husband and helps to meet family expenses. If she sees her capital increase, she would love to diversify her business to maximize her profit and be able to take better care of her household.

loans.use: to purchase smoked fish to resell during shortages

loans.name: Oyimkhol

texts.ru: Ойимхол способная женщина, умеющая шить и кроить платья. Ей 37 лет. Она заботливая жена и мать троих детей. Ойимхол живет со своей семьей в городе Дангара. У нее полтора года стажа работы в области шитья. Сейчас она хочет открыть собственный швейный бизнес. Чтобы воплотить свою мечту в реальность, она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она хочет купить модернизированную швейную машинку и ткани. Ойимхол будет заниматься этим делом у себя дома и отвела для этого специальное место. По ее словам она уже имеет своих постоянных клиентов, которые и в будущем собираются пользоваться ее услугами. Она ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en: Oyimkhol is a very capable woman, who knows how to cut and sew dresses.  She is 37 years old.  She is a caring wife and mother of three children.  Oyimkhol lives with her family in the city of Dangara.  She has a year and a half of experience in the sewing field.  Currently, she wants to open her own sewing business.  She requested a loan in order to make her dream come true.  She wants to use the loan amount to purchase a modern sewing machine and fabrics.  Oyimkhol will run this business from her house and set aside a designated place for it.  According to her own words, she already has regular clients, who plan to continue using her services in the future.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine and fabrics in order to start her own business

loans.name: Siradiou

texts.fr: Agé de 33 ans, monsieur Siradiou fait du commerce de produits divers depuis 4 ans. Siradiou s’étant marié un peu tard, il a de jeunes enfants, son ainé étant âgé de 4 ans seulement. Il fait de la vente de produits alimentaires  divers. Il est à sa première expérience de crédit et aimerait  s’approvisionner en denrées comme de l’huile, du café, du sucre, du riz, du savon etc... Il pourra améliorer  son stock de marchandises. Si son fond de roulement augmente, il aimerait  ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits alimentaires divers. A l'avenir il souhaite augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa petite famille
texts.en:
33 years old, Siradiou has been in the business of selling assorted products for 4 years. Having married later in life, he has young children; his oldest is only 4 years old. Siradiou is in the business of selling various food products. This will be his first loan and he would like to stock up on food products like oil, coffee, sugar, rice, soap, etc. This will enable him to increase his stock of merchandise.

If Siradiou's working capital increases, he would like to open a large store selling various food products. In the future he hopes to increase his earnings and to improve the living conditions of his small family.

loans.use: to purchase food products to resell

loans.name: Claritu

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Claritu works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo mat-weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from dress-making. Claritu is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase bamboo for her bamboo mat-weaving business.

Claritu has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Paligwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme PAYESSEDE ROSE DE LIMA  est responsable du groupe PALIGWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend du dolo (boisson local ou bière de mil) depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont  les hommes, les femmes et  les voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 02rangées de bois  et 03bassines de mil germé pour la préparation du dolo.
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne renforcer son activité et aider son mari pour les frais scolaire.
texts.en:
Ms. PAYESSEDE ROSE DE LIMA is the official of the group PALIGWENDE. She is doing well. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 5. Two go to school. And she has five persons to support. 

She has been selling 'dolo' (a local beverage or millet beer) for three years. She gets her supplies at the market in her district. Her customers are men, women, and neighbors. She wants to purchase 2 rows of firewood and 3 basins of germinated millet for making dolo. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to bolster her business and to help her husband cover the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase wood and millet to make 'dolo' to sell.

loans.name: Antu Rayen Group

texts.es: Fresia, quien en la fotografía aparece al medio tiene melena y flequillo, pertenece al Banco Comunal Antu Rayen, este Banco se caracteriza por tener venta de ropa nueva y usada, venta de comida al paso y colaciones invernadero y venta de verduras hidropónicas. Fresia tiene un negocio establecido de venta de ropa nueva,  el cual comenzó hace 4 años, ya que ella por trabajo de su marido debía ir a vivir a Lanco y como vivía en el campo se aburrió mucho, pensando en que debía comenzar un negocio se le ocurrió vender ropa usada, y con el tiempo y mucha perseverancia para salir adelante pudo empezar a vender ropa nueva. Estuvo muy mal un tiempo ya que tuvo a su suegra muy enferma, lo que ayudo a tener menos dinero ya que debían viajar mucho para poder acompañar a su suegra. Pero con ayuda de su marido y ahorros pudo salir adelante, ahora necesita dinero para poder surtir su negocio con más ropa, ya que al no tener más dinero no ha podido comprar. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de poder trabajar en grupo.
texts.en:
Fresia, who appears with long hair and bangs in the middle of the photo, belongs to the Antu Rayen Communal Bank. This Bank is made up of members who sell new and used clothing, sell food at small stands, work in greenhouses, and sell hydroponically-grown vegetables.

Fresia has an established business selling new clothing, which she started 4 years ago since she moved to Lanco due to her husband's job. She became bored living in the countryside and thought about opening a business, so it occurred to her to sell used clothing. With time and a lot of perseverance to move forward, she was able to begin selling new clothing.

Things were going poorly for a while because her mother-in-law was very sick, which cost a lot of money since she had to travel a lot to be able to be with her mother-in-law. But with the help of her husband and her savings, she was able to move past this.

Now, she needs money to be able to stock her business with more clothing, since she has not had the money to purchase anything. 

The thing that she likes the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is being able to work in a group.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Flor De Copihue Group

texts.es: Ana María, quien en la fotografía aparece al costado izquierdo de la fotografía con un sweater calipso de pelo corto y chasquilla, es socia del Banco Comunal Flor de Copihue, que está establecido en la ciudad de Valdivia. En este Banco Comunal los principales rubros son Repostería comida rápida y venta de ropa nueva y usada. El negocio de Ana María es venta de comida rápida, ella comenzó su negocio hace 6 años, lo comenzó con una amiga la cual no le ayudo mucho a la preparación, venta y entrega de los alimentos, así que tomo la decisión de independizarse le fue tan bien, que ha podido dar almuerzos y esperar a que le paguen después de un tiempo. Necesita el crédito para poder vender empanadas, de queso y pino, espera que le vaya muy bien ya que ha tenido mucha demanda de empanadas y por eso mismo requiere el dinero. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es lo maravilloso que han sido de poder ayudar y apoyar a las personas que realmente necesitan de un empujón económico para poder sacara adelante sus negocios.
texts.en:
Ana María, appearing to the left of the photo, wearing a calipso sweater, with short hair, and a bag, is a member of the  Flor de Copihue communal bank, from the city of Valdivia.  The members of the communal bank work with pastries, fast food, and new and used clothing sales.  Ana María sells fast food and started doing this six years ago.  She started with a friend who didn’t help very much, so she decided to go out on her own.  Things went well for her and she has been able to provide lunches and get paid later.

She needs this loan so she can sell cheese empanadas.  She expects things to go well for her because she has a large demand for empanadas and she needs money.  What she likes most is that she is able to work with the fund.  Hope is the wonderful thing that has helped and supported those who really need a financial push to move their businesses ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Las Laguinas Group

texts.es: Patricia, quien aparece al centro de la fotografía, de melena y chaqueta de cuero café, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Laguinas, las socias de este Banco Venden ropa nueva y usada, tienen negocios de costura, venta de anticuchos y repostería. El negocio de Patricia es la venta de ropa nueva. Comenzó vendiendo ropa usada en una feria de las pulgas y cuando puedo armarse de un pequeño capital, esto aproximadamente hace 1 año y medio,  empezó a vender ropa nueva, se le ocurrió este negocio ya que es una persona muy amistosa, y sus mismas amigas le ayudaron con la idea de vender ropa, son ellas las que le hacen propaganda para la venta de su ropa. No ha tenido mayores problemas, solo la falta de dinero para comprar más ropa, y el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar más ropa. Sabe que le irá muy bien. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que apoyan y ayudan  a agente que realmente necesita del dinero. También hace hincapié en el hecho de lo entretenidas que son las sesiones y lo importante que es que la institución pueda creer y confiar en las personas.
texts.en: Patricia, who appears in the center of the photo with long hair wearing a brown leather jacket, belongs to the communal bank "Las Laguinas."  The members of this group have the following types of businesses:  new and used clothing sales, dressmaking, kebab sales, pastry sales.  Patricia has a business selling new clothing.  She started out selling used clothing in a flea market, and when she had saved up some capital after a year and a half, she started to sell new clothing.  She chose this business because she is a very friendly person, and her friends helped her to come up with the idea of selling clothing.  They are also the ones who advertise her clothing business.  She's not had any major problems, only that she lacks money to buy more clothing.  The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing, and she knows that it will go very well.  What she has liked the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the fact that they support her and help people who really need the money. Also, she emphasizes the fact that the meetings are very entertaining, and also how important it is that the institution believes and trusts in people.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is a 19-year-old woman who is single, with no children. She runs a sewing shop business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Noel has requested a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, threads, needles, and other materials. She plans to use her profits to improve her business and provide for her family. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a overlock sewing machine, threads, needles, and other materials.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast.) She has been involved in this enterprise for 21 years. Ama is single and has four children. As a single mother, proceeds from her business normally go toward paying her children’s school fees and the general upkeep of the home. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands and also ensuring that her children receive quality education.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна молодая швея, проживающая в районе Хамадони. Ей 24 года. Она замужем и имеет одного годовалого сыночка. Ее муж мастер по ремонту телевизоров. В данный момент Мавзуна со своей семьей живет у своих родителей. Ее мать занимается торговлей фруктов. У Мавзуны среднее специальное образование. Она вот уже 8 лет как предоставляет услуги швеи. Мавзуна принимает заказы у себя дома. Она шьет красиво и по желанию клиенток делает на платьях красивые вышивки. Ей в деятельности помогает ее младшая сестра. Мавзуна сейчас намерена расширить свое дело. Для этого она просит кредит, чтобы приобрести модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку.
texts.en: Mavzuna is a young seamstress, living in the Hamadoni district.  She is 24 years old.  She is married and has one year-old son.  Her husband is a television repairman.  Currently, Mavzuna and her family live with her parents.  Her mother is involved in selling fruits.  Mavzuna has a secondary-specialized education.  She has been providing seamstress services for 8 years.  Mavzuna accepts her orders at home.  She sews beautifully and makes pretty embroidery on dresses in accordance with her customers' wishes.  Her younger sister helps her with the business.  Mavzuna currently intends to expand her business.  She is requesting a loan for this in order to purchase a modern, computerized sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a modern, computerized sewing machine to expand her business

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUMAR est un homme de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants âgés entre 12 et 2ans. Il loge en centre ville ou il exerce aussi son activité de vente des ustensiles de cuisine. Métier qu’il exerce depuis 09 ans. Il possède un magasin  qu’il a ouvert avec ses propres moyens. Seulement là il a besoin d’un crédit de 500000F CFA pour compléter  quelques bagages manquants parmi ceux qu’il expose déjà. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 18h.Il gère les besoins de ses enfants et de sa femme.
Et comme projet futur, il veut agrandir son espace commercial.
texts.en:
Oumar is a 39-year-old man, married and the father of 4 children between the ages of 12 years and 2 years. He lives downtown which is also where he runs his business of kitchen  utensils, a business he has been running for 9 years. He owns a shop which he opened with his own funds.

Oumar only needs a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to complete some missing packages among the ones that he already displays. He begins his day at 8am and works until 6pm. He takes care of the needs of his children and his wife. As a future goal, he hopes to increase his commercial space.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and resell them

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Coumba  est une vendeuse de légumes au marché local. Elle a démarré cette activité depuis plus de 03ans. Elle sollicite son 4ème  prêt pour  acheter des légumes : carottes, choux, pomme de terre, aubergine douce et aubergine amer, piment... En fait elle n’en manque pas, mais compte tenu de la période, sa clientèle en demande toujours davantage. Et pour ne pas rompre ce lien, elle décide d’être prudente et de disposer d’un fond  suffisant pour  ne pas être en rupture, car les clients pourraient aller voir ailleurs.
 Avec les fruits de son activité, elle se  prend en charge elle même en même temps que sa famille. 
Son seul souci est d’avoir une bonne assise dans son commerce et pour cela elle a besoin des préteurs
texts.en:
Coumba is a vegetable seller at the local market. She began this business more than 3 years ago. She is requesting her 4th loan to purchase vegetables: carrots, cabbage, potatoes, sweet and bitter eggplant, pepper, etc. She actually has plenty of vegetables, but taking into account the season, her customers are always requesting more. In order to avoid impacting this customer relationship, she decided to be cautious and to invest enough to avoid running out of stock, since the customers could then go elsewhere for their needs.

With the profits from her business, Coumba takes care of herself as well as her family. Her only concern is to have a successful course for her business and for this she needs lenders.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables that she resells at the market

loans.name: Joyceline

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Joyceline is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling eggs and secondhand clothes in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast.) She has been involved in this enterprise for a year. Joyceline is married and has two children. Her husband is carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. Joycelice wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of eggs and secondhand clothes. In the long term, Joycelice plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of eggs and secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Jeanesita

texts.en: Jeanesita is married to a carpenter of a poblacion, Sapang Dalaga in Misamis Occidental. She has four children. To make a living, she helps her husband with her general store. She had joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase goods like oil, soy sauce, milk canned and bottled products. She is very determined to improve the living situation of her family and wants to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to purchase goods like oil, soy sauce, milk canned and bottled products.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells porridge in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast.) She has been doing so for about 20 years. As a single mother with two children, Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Meafua

texts.en:
Meafua is a 36 year old married woman with one child.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Meafua has requested a loan to buy taro crops, fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, backpack sprayer and bush knives.

She has been a member of SPBD since this year. With her profits, Meafua hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to buy taro crops, fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, backpack sprayer and bush knives.

loans.name: Nana Ama

texts.en: Nana Ama is married with four children. She has received some schooling in middle school. Currently, Nana Ama sells rice and onions in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast.) She has been involved in this industry for about six years now. Her husband is a driver. Nana Ama’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Nana Ama will use the loan to increase her existing rice and onion inventory capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Nana Ama plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing rice and onion inventory capacity.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is divorced and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast.) She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. Aba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Evelyn is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evelyn has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 27000 loan amount through NWTF to buy paint, tires, spare parts, etc.

Evelyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy paint, tires, spare parts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rechel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rechel is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to  buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Rechel has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal fishing materials.

loans.name: Vailetai

texts.en: Vailetai is 26 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pies, pancakes and coconut buns in her community, and has been doing this for many years. Vailetai has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking soda and dripping oil. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vailetai will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, baking soda and dripping oil.

loans.name: Charoskhon

texts.ru: Чаросхон в течение четырех лет работает учительницей в средней школе, расположенной в районе Кубодиён. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и имеет сына. Ее муж работает в другой стране. Пока Чаросхон на работе, за сыном присматривает бабушка - свекровь Чаросхон. Одновременно Чаросхон предоставляет услуги швеи. Четыре года тому назад она закончила курсы «шитья и кройки» и до сегодняшнего дня она дома шьет женскую одежду. Чаросхон работает на двух работах, чтобы жить в достатке. И сейчас она берет кредит, чтобы купить компьютерную швейную машинку. Помимо обычных платьев она хочет вышивать и платья с вышивкой. Она надеется, что таким образом обретет новый источник дохода и к тому же количество ее постоянных клиентов увеличится.
texts.en:
Charoskhon has been teaching at a high school in Qubadiyon for four years. She is 26, is married, and has a son. Her husband works abroad. While she is at work, Charoskhon's mother-in-law takes care of her son.

Charoskhon also offers sewing services. Four years ago, she completed a course in sewing and tailoring, and to this day she makes women's clothing at home. Charoskhon works two jobs in order to stay financially comfortable. She is applying for a loan in order to buy a computerized sewing machine. In addition to regular dresses, she wants to to be able to make dresses with embroidery, in hopes that she will earn additional income and expand her regular client base.

loans.use: Для приобретения компьютерной швейной машинки

loans.name: Abriendo Caminos Group

texts.es: Sofía, quien en la fotografía aparece al costado derecho sentada en la segunda fila con chaqueta blanca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Abriendo Caminos de la ciudad de Concepción. En este Banco Comunal los rubros de los socios son principalmente venta en las ferias libres, venta de neumáticos, costura, confección de alta escala, venta de ropa y taller mecánico. Sofía tiene un pequeño emprendimiento, es una pequeña empresa de aseo. Hace 2 años que está con su emprendimiento, y esto se le ocurrió ya que ella trabajó 10 años en una empresa de aseo, con mucho esfuerzo ha comprado maquinarias de segunda mano para su pequeño negocio. Comenta que no ha tenido mayores problemas, y que necesita el dinero para poder comprar materiales tales como shampoo de alfombras, rodillos, decapante o removedor de cera, cera industrial, y un mantenedor.  Ella está muy contenta y expectante a poder recibir el dinero porque sabe que le irá muy bien con su negocio. Lo que más le ha gustado de poder trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho  de poder encontrar apoyo y ayuda necesarios para los negocios de las personas que son parte de Fondo Esperanza.
texts.en:
Sofía is wearing a white jacket, seated on the right side of the second row in the photo. She belongs to the " Abriendo Caminos" communal bank in the city of Concepción. The businesses of the members are mainly: market sales, selling tires, sewing,  high-end tailoring. selling rope and operating a mechanic's shop.

Sofia has a small undertaking, in the form of a cleaning business.  She has been in business for two years after having spent ten years working for a cleaning company. With a lot of effort she has bought second-hand machines for her business. 

Sofia notes that she has not had any major difficulties and that she needs the money to buy materials like carpet cleaner, rollers, paint stripper, wax remover, industrial wax and floor cleaner. She is very pleased and excited to get the money because she knows it will help her business. What she likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is being able to find the support and help necessary for the businesses of Fondo Esperanza members..

loans.use: to buy materials for her cleaning business.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюде 53 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. С 2012 года Мавлюда начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды, стартовав с суммой в 30,000 сом (KGS), Мавлюда сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях расширения ассортимента товаров, Мавлюда обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). Мавлюда планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара, а также в будущем хочет построить сарай для содержания скота и дополнительно заняться животноводством.
texts.en:
Mavlyuda is 53 years old, is married, and has five children. Since 2012, Mavlyuda has been selling women's clothing; she started with 30,000 KGS, was able to expand her business, and now earns about 3,000 KGS per month. 

In order to increase her assortment of women's wear, Mavlyuda is applying for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners. She plans to invest any profit from her business into further expanding product variety. In the future, she also intends to build a barn for livestock and to take up animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy women's wear for resale

loans.name: Vida Adjoa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Vida Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘wakye,' a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves, and cosmetics. She usually sells her ‘wakye’ in Nyame Bekyere (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘wakye’ for 4 years. Vida Adjoa is married with no children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses. Vida Adjoa wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘wakye’. In the long term, Vida Adjoa plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 22-year-old married woman without children. 
She has a small vegetable garden and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Jane has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, vegetable seeds, garden hose, rake and wheelbarrow. 
She has been a member of SPBD since this year. With her profits, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, vegetable seeds, garden hose, rake and wheelbarrow

loans.name: Konimba

texts.fr:
Né vers 1982 à FANA dans la  COMMUNE de N’GOLODIANA /Kolondièba  (3ème Région administrative du Mali) Konimba est marié avec deux enfants et réside avec  sa femme à Fana chez son père dans une famille traditionnelle.
