Thanks to Tynar’s hard work, her farm today includes four dairy cows, two calves, and 30 sheep. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to develop her business further, Tynar has turned to the “Bai Tushum & Partners microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy cows to increase her cattle headcount. Tynar plans to use the resulting income for a further increase of her livestock.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
María Consuelo tiene 29 años de edad, con 4 años de educación primaria cursados, comerciante y agricultora, madre de 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad. En compañía de su conyugue se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café el cual es posteriormente vendido en el mercado local siendo una fuente de ingresos más para su familia y hogar. Ella aprendió las diferentes tareas para el cultivo de café hace 4 años siendo su esposo quien le enseñara a trabajar la tierra. Ella también se dedica al comercio mientras no está en el campo, como otra fuente de ingresos más para su familia por medio de la venta de golosinas en una caseta en la escuela de la localidad siendo sus clientes los niños de la escuela y maestros de la institución. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 100 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a pie para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café.    

Sus sueños son los de poder ver a su hijo convertido en profesional mediante el estudio de una carrera universitaria la cual de frutos a su vida y a su familia, como también los de poder comprar más tierra para poder extender sus cultivos de café y fortalecer el patrimonio familiar. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento para poder invertir en sus cultivos de café mediante de compra de insumos como abono, fertilizantes, foliares y formula cafetalera.
texts.en:
María Consuelo, age 29, has four years of primary school education.  She is a merchant and a farmer, and she has one minor child.  She and her husband plant and grow coffee.  The coffee is later sold at the local market, and this is one more source of income for her family and her household.

She learned the different jobs about growing coffee four years ago.  Her husband is the one who taught her how to work the land.  She is also a merchant when she is not in the field.  As another source of income for her family, she sells candy at a stall in the local school.  Her customers are the children at  the school and the teachers at the institution.

Her coffee crops are located 100 meters from her house.  She travels by foot in order to provide maintenance and care to her coffee crops.

Her dream is to be able to see her son become a professional by studying for a university degree.  This will provide benefits to her life and her family.  She also dreams of being able to buy more land in order to be able to extend her coffee crops and strengthen the family heritage.

She is now requesting a loan in order to be able to invest in her coffee crops.  She will buy supplies like organic and chemical fertilizers, leaf pesticides, and coffee-growing formula.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to provide maintenance to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe del Carmen de 45 años de edad, vive junto a su familia su esposo y sus 4 hijos mayores de edad que junto a su esposo  le ayudan en el aporte económico a su hogar. Es una mujer comprometida y trabajadora; Actualmente trabaja en un comedor de una playa conocida de nuestro país, su compañero de vida es albañil y juntos tienen una necesidad de poder reparar una pared de su hogar ya que se encuentra muy agrietada es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, la mano de obra la pondrá su esposo. Espera pueda lo antes posible realizar dicha reparación para evitar mayores daños.
texts.en: Guadalupe del Carmen is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 adult children, who in conjunction with her husband help her support the household financially.  She is a committed and hard working woman.  Currently, she works in a restaurant at a well known beach in her country.  Her husband is a bricklayer and they are in need of repairing a wall in their home since it is very cracked.  For this reason, they are seeking a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement and sand, her husband will provide the labor.  She hopes to be able to make the repair as soon as possible in order to avoid heavier damage.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand to repair cracks in a wall.

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en:
Sunny is requesting a loan to buy various vegetable seeds like cabbage, eggplant and squash for her husband to plant and harvest. She will also use the loan to buy rice and other seasonings needed for preparing food snacks to sell to her fellow vendors. She has been in this business for 15 years and is earning an average of PHP 3,000 monthly. Sunny says that if she is not able to sell, life is dead. 

Sunny married at an early age, after her junior year in high school. Her husband, Leonardo, works as a farmer and gardener. She has three children who are all students. They live in the village of Nagbitin, a peaceful place for them. Sunny is 42 years old.

loans.use: to buy various vegetable seeds like cabbage, eggplant and squash, and to buy ingredients for prepared food to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lorna has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets.

She has been in this business for 28 years.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: A mother of four children originally from Battambang province, Chhem is a rice grower and vendor. She has engaged in her current business for six years. This is the first loan for Chhem with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is taking out a loan of 650,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this purchase will help her to replant her cash crop soon and earn her a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and rice seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ofelia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ofelia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy-and-sell rice business.

Ofelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: A villager from Ponhea Leu district of Kandal province, Sambo is 43 years old and a married mother of eight children. Her entire family solely relies on rice farming which she has been doing for several years with 19,000 KHR per day as daily income. Sambo is now leading her first microloan group consisting of eight borrowers taking their first loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  For Sambo, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes this latrine will improve sanitation practices in her family.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Ulaelemamae

texts.en: Ulalemamae is 19 years old and lives with her partner and one child. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community; she has been doing this for two years. Ulalemamae has requested a loan to buy garlic, soya sauce, pots, tongs, a bbq set, abox of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce, foil and mutton flaps. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ulalemamae will hope to expand her business within nearby villages.

loans.use: to buy garlic, onions, soya sauce, pots, tongs, a bbq set, abox of chicken, sausages, tomato sauce, foil and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en:
Taufau is a 57 year old married woman with 7 children. 
She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Taufau has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water tank for a water reservoir. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Taufau hopes to improve her family's home condition.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals and a water tank for a water reservoir

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Né vers 1975 à Bamako capitale du Mali Mariam est mariée et mère de deux enfants, résidant avec son mari à Kolondièba au quartier Koko, dans une famille traditionnelle.
 Mme Mariam s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la vente du dégué et des petits articles.  Elle est très sollicitée au marché et surtout pendant le jour de foire.
Fort de ses années d’expériences dans le domaine, elle collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso pour augmenter  son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse de grandir et est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir remboursé le prêt précédent. 
Mariam  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des céréales, du sucre et du lait. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au marché. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant en famille et au marché le jour de foire à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Mariam  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1975 in Bamako, the capital of Mal, Mariam is married and the mother of two children, and lives with her husband Kolondièba in the Koko neighborhood, in a traditional family. Mrs Mariam was quickly interested in commercial activity, in particular related to the sale of dégué [a local Malian drink made from millet, a common african cereal] and small articles. She is very often solicited at the market, notably during the main market days. Building on her experiences in this domain, she is collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso to enlarge her business in order to better satisfy her growing customer base, by asking for her second loan, after having correctly reimbursed the first one.

Mariam plans to use this loan to purchase cereals, sugar and milk. She stocks up at the wholesalers in the market. She sells her merchandise individually for cash to families as well as during market day, to a customer base composed of both men and women. Mariam hope to earn monthly profit of 60 000 FCFA, which she will use to cover the needs of her family, reimburse her loan, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase cereals, milk and sugar

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед живет и работает в северной части Таджикистана в городе Худжанд. Ему 33 года. Хуршед женат на Шоире и имеет двух сыновей. Шоира занимается торговлей одежды на рынке. Хуршед работает сантехником. Скоро дети Хуршеда и Шоиры пойдут в школу. В наше время собрать ребенка в школу нелегко. Хуршед собирается открыть свой интернет кафе и просит кредит, чтобы приобрести 8 штук настольных компьютеров. Он уже арендовал помещение, расположенное в людном месте. Данный кредит позволит ему открыть собственный бизнес и иметь постоянный источник дохода. Он будет благодарен за поддержку.
texts.en: Khurshed lives and works in the northern city of Khujand, Tajikistan. He is 33 years old. Khurshed is married to Shoira and they have two sons. Shoira works selling clothing at the market. Khurshed works as a plumber. Soon, Khurshed and Shoira's children will start school. In our day, it is not easy to put a child through school.  Khurshed is going to open an internet cafe and is asking for a loan to buy eight desktop computers. He has rented a building in a busy location. This loan will allow him to open his own business and have a regular source of income. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: buy eight computers to open an internet cafe.

loans.name: Guillermo Arturo

texts.en:
Guillermo, a Tlaxcalan hog farmer, believes in the importance of small, family-owned local farms - a group in danger of extinction. Guillermo faces two major hurdles - his production costs and complaints from his neighbors, as his farm is in a recently urbanized area.

His 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will treat the large piles of pig manure he has on-site (pictured) to produce odor-free, potent biofertilizer and renewable, methane-rich biogas. The resulting displacement of fossil-fuel based agrochemical fertilizers and liquefied petroleum gas will save him money, and the elimination of piles of animal waste will dramatically reduce the flies and odors associated with hog farming. Concurrently, Guillermo will reduce his farm's environmental impact. 

This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: to purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Nerio

texts.en:
Nerio is a long way from home. Originally from Colombia, he resides in Houston, Texas, working as a bookkeeper and tax preparer. His business, Easybooks, has assisted Houston residents during tax season for more than eight years. He specializes in assisting Spanish-speaking citizens and immigrants in the area.  

When Nerio needed extra money to purchase computer equipment and programs, a friend informed him about Accion Texas Inc., the nation’s largest microlender. After applying and receiving a business loan from Accion, Nerio proceeded to purchase additional equipment so that he can expand and process a higher volume of tax returns. Nerio purchased computer software to make his job easier and more efficient.  

All these improvements allowed Nerio to grow his business, retain his one full-time and two part-time employees, and make plans to hire an additional part-time worker soon. “Without the Accion loan I would not have been able to purchase what I needed to grow my business”, says Nerio.

loans.use: to purchase computer software to make his job easier and more efficient.

loans.name: Sithol

texts.en: Sithol is a young man residing in Kandal province. He has been a policeman for one year. Sithol wants to pursue his bachelor degree majoring in Law to support him in his career. Therefore, he has applied for an education loan with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) as a first-time borrower. He will spend his entire loan to support his education as he does not want to burden his parent. He hopes that he can get a better job with a high salary after graduation to support himself as well as his family.

loans.use: To support the cost of his education.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an addition stock of groceries to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Teresa aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase an addition stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nelgen

texts.en:
Nelgen is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelgen is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Nelgen has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Nelgen has been in this business for one year. In the future, Nelgen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 62 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living as a fish pond operator in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her fish.

Teresita has been a fish pond operator for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her fish

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 70 years old and married and works hard to support her husband.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc, to sell for her general store business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc, to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials need for fishing for her fishing/fish vending business.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Maria Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business and afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for fishing.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis knows finance. After graduating from Rochester Institute of Technology with a degree in psychology and business, Dennis became an assistant manager at Household Finances in Newark. Over the next 30 years he worked with various businesses on the financial side. Then in February 2011, Dennis was laid off from his job as director of credit services.
 
Prior to his career in finance, Dennis had learned a wide variety of skills working part-time for a friend that owned a cleaning business. He mastered floor buffing, bathroom cleaning, floor waxing, garbage removal and his favorite, window cleaning. 

Two years ago, after he lost his job, Dennis bought a franchise specializing in window cleaning. He now cleans commercial property and residential homes. Today, the business is known for its dependability and unmatched customer service.  

Dennis will use the funds of this loan to purchase cleaning tools that are able to reach greater surfaces on the windows. His long term goal is to grow the business and to employ ten window cleaners.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning tools that are able to reach greater surfaces on the windows.

loans.name: Jahaziel Nieves

texts.en:
Jahaziel dreams of working in environmental engineering but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Jahaziel was accepted into the Universidad Tecnológica Boliviana and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in December, 2015 but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. Her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return.

Jahaziel shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Jahaziel plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her tuition. To help pay for her education Jahaziel currently works 25 hours a week as a waitress. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and focus on her studies. With a career in engineering, she expects to earn $34 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one younger brother, Jahaziel hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Fotu

texts.en:
Fotu is a 49-year-old who is married with two children. She has a small business, a taro plantation. To earn extra income, she also has a vegetable garden. 

Fotu needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizers, weed spray and a wheelbarrow. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education and to extend her business. Fotu joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy weed spray, fertilizers, chemicals, taro crops, vegetable seeds and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en: Mr. Altansukh, 36 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a house on a plot of land. He has been working as a technician at a border military base since 1995. His wife is unemployed and looks after their children. He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy furniture such as drawers, a wardrobe and television for his house. These will make the house a more comfortable place for living and give him the enthusiasm to work harder.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is requesting a loan that will serve as start-up capital for her fruit and vegetable business. She will buy eggplants, green leafy vegetables, cabbage, squash and other food to sell. She wants to do this because she wants to assist her husband support the family. 

Alma is 47 years old. Married to a carpenter, they are blessed with four children. She was 22 years old when she got married. Together with her family, she happily living in a simple village in the Nueva Vizcaya Province.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, green leafy vegetables, cabbages, squash and other food to sell.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Fatima está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de todas. Con mucho esfuerzo, y con su sacrificio están creciendo y saliendo adelante.
Margarita es una de estas mujeres, quien está mejorando su economía gracias a su trabajo y también a las capacitaciones que viene recibiendo.   Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, lo que le ayuda a poder dar a su vez a su familia todo lo que necesitan y que no les falte nada. Agradece ella por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, de poder invertir en su microemprendimiento.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, y de esa forma poder seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“Virgen de Fatima” is a group that has taken the poverty elimination survey so that each member can become familiar with her situation.  Through great effort and sacrifice, the members have grown and forged ahead.  

Margarita is one of these women.  She is improving her financial situation thanks to her work and the training that she has received.  Margarita sells fruits and vegetables in order to provide her family with everything that they need so that they lack nothing.  She appreciates the opportunity she has received to invest in her microenterprise.  

Sra. Margarita is requesting a loan so that she can buy fruits and vegetables.  This will allow her to continue investing in her work, help to solidify her business plan, and help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es: Nancy Carolina de 25 años de edad habita junto a su madre, hermana y su sobrino. Gracias a Dios residen en casa humilde pero propia, es una mujer muy emprendedora que desea siempre hacer lo mejor para su madre. En esta ocasión poco a poco ha ido mejorando su casa pero le falta encementar el piso y mejorar una pared es por esa razón que solicito un préstamo a FUSAI un préstamo para el pago de la mano de obra y los materiales de construcción como ladrillo de barro, cemento, grava, hierro etc. Ella trabaja y es muy responsable ese es su respaldo para el pago de su préstamo. Espera que sea lo más pronto posible así se sentirá feliz y satisfecha.
texts.en: Nancy Carolina, who is 25 years old, lives with her mother, her sister, and her nephew. Thankfully, they live in a house that is humble but their own. She is a very driven woman who always wants to do what is best for her mother. She has been improving her home little by little but at this time she still needs to pour cement on the floors and repair a wall. That is why she has requested a loan from FUSAI, so she can pay for labor and construction materials like bricks, cement, gravel, iron, etc. She works and is very responsible, which is how she is backing repayment of this loan. She hopes to pay it off as soon as possible. That would make her feel happy and satisfied.

loans.use: to pay for labor and construction materials like bricks, cement, gravel, iron, etc.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, son and mother. The family is involved in the agricultural business. They have a land where potatoes and haricots are grown and sold. 

They work hard and always have high quality products, which are sold to local retailers. Tea had a dairy business, but she had to sell her cows because of her son's health problems. Now her son is well and she decided to be involved in dairy business and requested a loan. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, gives her a chance to get a loan of 4,000 GEL to purchase cows. After the cows are purchased, she will be able to continue her dairy business and produce and sell cheese products. The Start Up program will be a great support for her.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to continue her business and     produce and sell cheese products.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.

She sells used clothing in the Philippines, and earns additional income by raising pigs. Luzminda is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of used clothes to sell.

Luzminda has been managing her business through her past twenty loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Raúl Alberto

texts.es: Raúl tiene 56 años de edad, padre soltero de 1 hijo de 23 años. Se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, pues ha tenido tiendas y billares en el Amazonas, donde vivió durante 25 años. Actualmente tiene un negocio de café bar donde ofrece gaseosas, licores, mecato, bebidas calientes, entre otros, lo inició hace un año y medio y le ha dado buenos resultados, ya que está ubicado en una zona muy transitada en las noches; de esta forma ha generado los ingresos necesarios para sacar adelante a su hijo y para solventar las necesidades básicas de su vivienda. Se encuentra solicitando el crédito para invertir el dinero en la compra de surtido al por mayor (licores, café, mecato, gaseosas) y realizar mejoras locativas (pintar el negocio), de esta manera dará una nueva imagen al establecimiento que cambiará la percepción de los transeúntes, atrayendo más clientela y, además tendrá variedad de productos disponible para satisfacer los gustos de sus visitantes; dando como resultado un incremento en sus ventas y en los ingresos que recibe. Raúl es consciente que debe seguir trabajando arduamente, con esmero y dedicación para lograr cumplir el objetivo de seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y hacer que sea reconocido y más rentable, para que le permita disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y continuar velando por el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Raúl is 56 years old and is a single dad to his 23-year-old son. When he lived in the Amazon region for 25 years, Raúl made a living operating various stores and billiard halls. Presently, he runs a café and bar where he sells a variety of products, including: soft drinks, liquors, hot drinks, snacks, etc. He started the café-bar a year and a half ago and business is going well, thanks to Raúl's hard work and the prime location of the store in a popular, well-traveled area. This business is Raúl's source of income for supporting his son and covering his costs of living.

With the support from this loan, Raúl plans to purchase merchandise in bulk to stock his café-bar, including liquors, coffee, soft drinks, snacks, etc. He also plans to make some improvements to the café, including repainting the walls and other areas. He hopes that this investment will give the business a fresh look and will increase the variety of products he sells so he can attract more customers. In turn, he hopes these changes will also lead to increased sales and income, allowing him to improve his quality of life and better provide for his son. Raúl is well aware that he needs to continue working hard in order to fulfill his goals of growing and strengthening his business and increasing its notoriety in the region.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his business, including liquors, coffee, soft drinks, etc., and to make improvements to his business and repaint the walls.

loans.name: Ky's Group

texts.en: Ky is a young married mother of three dependent kids residing in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. Nowadays, one of her kids is studying in a primary school while other two children are still too young for schooling. To support the entire household, she does rice cropping on one and a half hectare area while her husband catches fish to sell. Her business, which she conducted for ages, has returned her about 21,400 KHR per day. This is the third loan for Ky with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past successful loan, which she has repaid completely, has enabled her to improve her living conditions to better than they were before, especially in providing three decent meals and appropriate clothes for her children. Now she is a leader in a group of three borrowers. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She strongly believes that this can prevent current illness due to the lack of sanitation practices.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Chreop's Group

texts.en: Chreop is 43 years old and a resident from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She is a mother of two children who are in school.  Her main source of family income is from her occupation at a factory and rice farming on a two hectare area. This business has returned her about 23,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Chreop with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan and used it wisely to improve her living conditions to better than they were before. Now, in a group of three borrowers, she is the leader.  She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that she can own a proper latrine for her family to prevent any illness due to the lack of sanitation practices.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Nyakanyinya Group

texts.en: Kellen is a member of the Nyakanyinya group. She has been a member of the Nyakanyinya group for a long time and says she has benefited a lot from the group since the group members guarantee her whenever she needs loans from UGAFODE Microfinance. She is proud to belong to the group and is in the farming business which she has done since 2000. She works on the farm for an average of seven hours per day and she also does trade which is her other source of income. She does the business in her local cell of Nyakanyinya and she started the business with a motive of getting money to help her earn a living. She would like to use the money (six hundred thousand shillings) to buy fertilizers and produce and she has hopes of buying a big piece of land for her agriculture business in the near future. She says infertile soil and weather changes are her main challenges but she has hopes that they will be overcome with time.

loans.use: To buy fertilisers

loans.name: Lagomau

texts.en:
Lagomau is a 40-year-old married woman with 8 children.
 
She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lagomau has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, chemicals, taro crops, backpack sprayer, and wheelbarrow.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. With her profits, Lagomau hopes to support her family .

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, chemicals, taro crops, backpack sprayer, and wheelbarrow for her taro plantation.

loans.name: Easter

texts.en:
Easter is 26 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years.

Easter has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, an oven and yeast. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Easter will pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a frying pan, cooking oil, an oven and yeast.

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en: Taimane is 18 years old and has a partner with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. She has requested a loan to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, shovels and fertilizer. With her profits, Taimane hopes to save for her family's needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, shovels and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdujamil

texts.ru: Абдучамил начинающий бизнесмен, он хочет открыть интернет кафе у себя дома и просит кредит, чтобы приобрести 5 персональных компьютеров. Он уверен, что сможет в одну из комнат дома вместить компьютеры. Абдучамилу 25 лет. Он живет с родителями и с братишкой, то есть, место для бизнеса будет родительский дом, который расположен рядом со школой. Это весьма хорошее месторасположение для его бизнеса. Абдучамил еще не женат, но хочет в ближайшее время обзавестись семьей. Поэтому он начинает свой бизнес, чтобы в будущем заработать на свой дом.
texts.en: Abdujamil is a novice businessman. He wants to open an internet cafe in his home, and is asking for a loan to buy five computers. He is confident that he can fit all of the computers in one room of his home. Abdujamil is 25 years old. He lives with his parents and little brother. Therefore, the business will be in his parents' home, which is located next to a school. This is a very good location for his business. Abdujamil is not married yet, but wants to start a family soon. So he is starting his business to earn enough for his own home.

loans.use: buy five computers to open an internet cafe.

loans.name: Amadou Thierno

texts.fr:
Monsieur Amadou Thierno est un commerçant qui a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier.  Il a une expérience de 8 ans dans ce domaine. Amadou Thierno est âgé de 56 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. C’est un habitué du guichet car il a déjà eu à bénéficier de 3 crédits pour renforcer son activité. Etant dans une zone très fréquentée, il a l’opportunité de fructifier son commerce car il y a une forte demande.  
Avec le crédit, il va acheter les denrées les plus rapides à écouler comme le sucre, le lait, le thé, le savon... 
Malgré son âge, Amadou Thierno s’est très tôt responsabilisé dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. C’est lui qui se charge de la nourriture ; il s’occupe aussi des frais de scolarité de ses enfants, mais réussi tout de même à mettre de l’argent de coté. Dans l’avenir il voudrait agrandir sa boutique avec l’appui des préteurs
texts.en:
Amadou Thierno is a retailer who runs a general food store in his neighborhood. He has eight years' experience in this field, is 56 years of age, and is a married father of four children. He is a regular at the local branch of the institution, as he has already had three loans to strengthen his business. As he works in an area that is always busy, he has been able to make the most of his business as there is a lot of demand.  

With this loan, Amadou Thierno plans to buy those goods which sell the quickest, such as sugar, milk, tea, soap, etc. Despite his age, he was quick to take responsibility for the daily expenses, and he is the one who provides the food and pays for his children's education. Even with these expenses, he still manages to put some money aside. In the future, he would like to expand his business with support from lenders.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale in his store

loans.name: Juan Hernan

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de edad, habita junto a su madre en casa de su propiedad desde hace 10 años, es un hombre entregado al trabajo y a los cuidados de su madre. Siempre la superación esta en la mente de Juan, ya que trabaja como panificador, elabora pan francés, pan de dulce etc. Es así como se gana la vida honradamente, desea construir una fosa séptica ya que por higiene lo necesita pero no tiene el recurso monetario suficiente es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como cemento, malla soldada, codo para tubo, varilla etc. Confía en que pronto podrá realizar este sueño y el y su madre se quedaran satisfechos de haberlo logrado.
texts.en: Juan is 42 years old and has been living alongside his mother in their privately-owned house for the last ten years.  Juan is dedicated to his work and looking after his mother.  Juan is always looking to get ahead in life.  He works as a baker and makes various kinds of bread.  With this work he earns an honest living.  Juan wants to build a septic tank as he needs it for hygiene reasons.  However, he does not have enough money to carry out this work and so is applying for FUSAI for a loan. He will use the loan to buy building materials such as cement, metal bars, mesh, and plumbing joints.  Juan trusts that, soon, he will be able to fulfill his dream of building the tank and, then, he and has mother will be very satisfied with the work they will have done.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, metal bars, mesh, and plumbing joints.

loans.name: Dina Magali

texts.es: Dina de 24 años de edad, habita junto a su familia en casa de su propiedad. Es una mujer muy trabajadora que actualmente trabaja como administradora de una tienda de ropa, es su forma de ganarse la vida honrada y decentemente. Siempre ha sido responsable con su familia y su trabajo. Porque ya tiene 20 años de vivir en su hogar ha notado que el techo esta desmejorado, se filtra el agua, cuando llueve fuerte y le mojan las pocas cosas que suele tener es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como lamina, polines, cemento etc. Espera pronto poder realizar su sueño y cambiarlo lo mas antes posible
texts.en: Dina is 24 years old and lives alongside her family in their privately owned home.  Dina is very hard-working and currently makes a living as a manager in a clothes shop.  With this she can earn a decent and honest living.  Dina has always been responsible with her family and her work.  After 20 years of living in the house, Dina has noticed that the state of the roof has deteriorated - water leaks in during heavy rainfall and soaks the few things that the family owns.  So, Dina is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy building materials such as metal sheets, cement, and more.  She hopes that she can soon achieve her dream and change the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as metal sheets, cement, and more.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David de 29 años de edad, habita junto a su familia, su esposa y sus hijos es un hombre muy visionario y trabajador. Habitan en casa humilde pero propia y eso lo hace acreedor de sentirse satisfecho del trabajo que ha realizado hasta este momento, poco a poco ha ido mejorando su hogar y desea seguir haciéndolo es por esa razón que se acerco a FUSAI para solicitar un préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción ya que necesita repellar la pared para ellos necesita cemento y también comprar lamina y reparar la parte de un cuarto que se mantiene en mal estado.
texts.en: David is 29 years old and living alongside his family, his wife, and his children.  David is a visionary and very hard-working.  He and his family live in a humble home but they do own it.  This helps them to feel satisfied with the work they have done up until now.  Little by little David has been making improvements to the house and he wants to continue with this.  So, he has applied for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy building materials in order to plaster the wall.  David needs cement and also metal sheets to repair part of the room which is deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to plaster the wall.  David needs cement and also metal sheets to repair part of the room which is deteriorated.

loans.name: Janeffer

texts.en:
Janeffer is a single mother of one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a young brother). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent 

She has a business of selling used clothes  and has been in  this business for seven years and sells on a retail basis only. She moves door to door selling used clothes. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her major business challenges include rainy season, which hinders her movements.  She is aspiring to get a permanent business premise and also to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita manages a general store business. She is requesting for a loan that will serve as added capital in buying stock like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, and more products to sell. She has been in this business for 20 years and most of the time, she has earned an income of PHP 2,500 monthly that has been used in supporting her grandchildren's needs and saving for future use. 

Nenita is now 57 years old and a mother of three children. She is now widowed and living happily with her two children and grandchildren in the village of Nagbitin.

loans.use: buy stock like canned goods, noodles, seasonings, etc to sell.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is a single mother, age 40, living in Kagadi, Uganda. She works in the local government, but also operates a boutique dealing in second-hand clothes. A good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to the University and to buy land for farming. 

Oliver intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a 45-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For eleven years he has been running a retail shop, but also earns a salary as a teacher. Like most traders, he is challenged by price fluctuations and high license fees. His desire is to expand his business to a new area. 

Juma intends to use the loan to buy popcorn and eggs to sell.

loans.use: to buy popcorn and eggs to sell.

loans.name: Asastazia

texts.en: Asastazia is a 40 year old hard working woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She sells fresh foods but also practices farming in order to earn a living.  Her challenges include perishability of her stock due to lack of adequate preservation equipment.  Her dream is to own refrigerators. Asastazia  intends to use the loan to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Sin's Group

texts.en: Sin is a widowed mother with seven children residing in Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district. To overcome the family's hardship, she sells corn and raises pigs while her husband works at a construction site. Having engaged in her current business for 10 years, she is able to earn almost up to 22,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she and other two borrowers are asking for their first-cycle loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy wood to build walls for her house. She hopes this purchase will help her in time.

loans.use: To buy wood to build walls for her house

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Esmeralda is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed to sell.

Esmeralda has been raising livestocks for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed to sell

loans.name: Augustino Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 49 year old businessman who does business in Yei Town, South Sudan. He heard about Finance South Sudan Limited through other clients. He is married and has 6 children. 2 of them go to school. His business involves selling merchandise goods like soap, sugar, salt, beer and other retail goods. He has been doing this business for 3 years now.
Moses is borrowing a loan worth 2000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him buy more items for the shop. He intends to pay back the loan through the profits from the business.

loans.use: To buy items like soap, sugar, salt and other retail goods

loans.name: Caeser

texts.en:
Caeser is 30 years old and struggled to find a job after school. He therefore started a small stationery shop with some money from his brother. He has been in this business for three years now and he sells his stationery to local residents around Kyotera.
Caeser has requested this loan in order to re-stock his business and supply his clients adequately in this season when students and pupils are going  back to school.
His major hope is to expand his business so that he can start selling on a wholesale level. However, he has a challenge of limited capital to expand the business and low demand of these items during periods when schools are closed for holidays.

loans.use: To buy scholastic materials to sell

loans.name: Kolis

texts.en:
A young mother of one kid living in a village of the Phnom Proek district, Kolis is 25 years old and married. Her kid is too young for school. The source for her family's income is mainly from corn, soybeans and cassava farming. She has been in this business for three years. 

Kolis has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles already, and she completely paid back the previous loans, which enabled her to improve her family's living conditions. 

Now she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR in order to pay for her farming, such as growing soybeans, and she will use a portion of the loan to pay for raising pigs. With this loan, she hopes to make enough income that she can set aside some money to send her kid to school and also extend her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for her farming.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 50 years old and married with two children. She has been running a food café for the last two years and the business has been doing great. She has been able to employ two people to help her run the business well. In five years time she wants the café to have grown into a restaurant that will generate enough income for her family. 

She knew about Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she could save and access credit to fund her business. She is now seeking a loan to buy maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for the business. The challenges that she faces include competition and customers not paying on time. Extra income from the loan will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gaudius

texts.en:
Gaudius is 32 years old and married with six children and one dependent, whom he looks after due to the death of his parents. Gaudius is an agriculturalist who majorly deals in coffee growing. He owns about four acres of coffee plantation in his region. He also operates a retail shop of  UGX (Ugandan shillings) 1,000,000 capital, where he generates additional income to supplement his income. 

From the income realized from coffee sales, he has managed to look after his family and construct for them a permanent house. However, Gaudius’ biggest challenge is inadequate income to pay school fees for his children. On top of that, seasonal changes affected his earnings, as most of his coffee was hit by sunshine and dried up.

He is applying for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation. 

His dream is to see all his children study up to university.

Gaudius is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: M. Nawaz

texts.en:
M. Nawaz is 47 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
He is the father of three children and all of them go to school.  He is a cattle trader by profession, buying cattle from different villages and selling them to the butchers. Now that Eid-ul-Azha (Muslim religious holiday) is about to come, demand for cattle will increase. In these days, he sells his cattle to the common people. Also during these days, the demand for bull calves peak. Every year in this season he offers a bull calve to the common people. He brings his all bull calves to the animal market and stays with the cattle 10 to 15 days. After selling his cattle he goes back to home to celebrate Eid festival with his family. 
M. Nawaz wants to buy more bull calves to sell in the market but he lacks funds this year.
Therefore, M. Nawaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that he could buy more bull calve to sell. He hopes that he will pay all the installments on time. With the profit, he will buy new dresses and shoes for his family to celebrate the Eid festival. 
He hopes that this season he will be a more profitable business than before.
M. Nawaz is very pleased after taking this loan and is thankful to the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy bull calves to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 28 años, está casada con Amalia y tiene 1 hijo, con quien vive en su casa propia. Siempre tuvo gusto por la cocina iniciándose en pequeños negocios de comidas en distintos puntos de su localidad.
Esto le sirvió para hacerse conocido y a la vez obtener buenas ganancias que le permitirían obtener buenos ingresos para hacer posible la apertura de un local y posteriormente convocar a dos ayudantes debido a la buena clientela. Se caracteriza por tener una buena sazón en la preparación de platos a base de pescados  y mariscos tales como ceviche, chilcanos, parihuelas y otros de alta demanda siendo también caracterizado por la higiene y buen trato. Lleva 5 de experiencia y esto lo motiva a cumplir uno de sus principales objetivos que es la adquisición de un local propio a futuro para mejorar sus ingresos con la mayor asistencia de clientela. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de pescado fresco al por mayor ya que es un experto en este tipo de comidas.
texts.en:
Cesar is 28 years old, married to Amalia, and has one child.  They live in their own home.  Cesar has always enjoyed cooking, so he started small food businesses in different parts of town.  

Cooking has helped him to become well-known and to earn a good income.  Since he has been able to generate good profits, Cesar opened a restaurant and eventually hired two assistants because of the good clientele.  Cesar is known for preparing delicious fish and seafood dishes such as “ceviche” (seafood marinated in citrus juice), Peruvian fish soup, seafood stew, and other foods that are in high demand.  He is also known for his cleanliness and for providing good service.  Cesar has five years of experience, which has motivated him to fulfill one of his main objectives of acquiring another shop of his own in the future so that he can improve his earnings and serve more customers.  

This is his second Kiva loan and he appreciates the financial support he has received that will allow him to continue forward.  In addition, Cesar promises to complete his payments in a punctual manner.  He is taking this opportunity to borrow 2,000 PEN so that he can buy fresh fish in bulk since he is an expert in these types of dishes.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish in bulk.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as sugar, rice, salt, onions, etc. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tina needs a loan to buy bags of rice, flour, sugar and salt, onions, tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and crates of Vailima (brand) beer. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, flour, sugar and salt, onions, tinned fish, tomato sauce, noodles, toilet paper, snacks, cigarettes and crates of Vailima (brand) beer.

loans.name: Flormelyn

texts.en:
Flormelyn had engaged in direct selling but stopped the business. Now, with the lenders' help, she is requesting a loan to pursue her Avon direct selling and soap retailing in her village. With the support of the loan, she will buy bigger volumes of soap from factories in Bulacan Province and will also reactivate her Avon dealership. 

She is now 37 years old with four children. Her husband works as a regular driver for the Pepsi company. Her ultimate goal in life is to support her children's education so they could have a better life than she has had. She once has the chance of completing her college but did not.

loans.use: to buy bigger volumes of soap from factories in Bulacan Province and also to reactivate her Avon dealership.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old from Nakuru. She is married to Peter who is a mechanic, and they have three children aged 13, 10 and 7 years old.

She owns a general store which has been in operation for the last year, and since she wants to replenish her stock she has applied for her second loan of Kshs 40,000 from Kadet Ltd.

Eunice's income right now is Kshs 18,000 per month and she intends to use the profit from her expanded business in renovating her residential house.

Her hopes and dreams are that in the future she will educate her children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her general store, e.g. phone accessories, and the rest to be used in paying a bill for the connection of electricity.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mon, 44, is the father of five sons. He lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district. All of his sons are dependent on him and still in school. He has been planting rice for 30 years as the main source of his income while his wife earns extra income by growing vegetables. Currently, Mon can earn around 45,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Mon’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He has completely repaid the previous loan, which improved his family’s living condition and enabled him to keep his sons in school. Mon is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR while his other group member is applying for 500,000 KHR. Mon, who is the leader, wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer, vegetable and rice seed, and to pay a portion of plowing fees. With this loan, he hopes to make more income so as to enlarge his business to raise cows.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable and rice seed, and to pay for plowing

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Vitolia

texts.en: Vitolia is a 46-year-old single mother of two children. She makes and sells sandwiches, pork cake, pancakes and coffee in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Vitolia needs a loan to buy boxes of milk, coffee mix, foam cups, black coffee, eggs, mayonnaise and onions. She plans to use her profits to improve the quality of her business to support her family. Vitolia became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, coffee mix, foam cups, black coffee, eggs, mayonnaise and onion

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en: Siniva is a 35-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She has a small business operating taxi services. She has 2 years with this business. She needs a loan to buy car brakes, seat covers, new tires and pay for a taxi registration renewal. She will use her profits to support her family. Siniva joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy car brakes, seat covers, new tires and pay for a taxi registration renewal.

loans.name: Mwanakame

texts.en:
Mwanakame is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mwanakame makes dumplings which she sells to neighbors and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Lilian Njeri

texts.en:
Lilian grew up and got married in central Kenya. This is the region with coffee, tea, and dairy farming. Its also the region that has had a lot of problems with deforestation, hence there have been water shortages in the recent years. Lilian is no exception from the millions of women who use wood and dung fuels for cooking and kerosene for lighting. Their income levels can not enable them to install and sustain electricity energy. The situation is not easy now that the forests are reserved and therefore getting wood is becoming harder. Like her neighbors, she has to suffer every weekend walking up and down the hills to go fetch water and collect wood to last her a week so that she can till the land during weekdays.

Lilian learned about VEP and the biogas project during a training at her church, and determined to resolve the fuel issue she approached VEP to help her construct one at her home. She has received a biogas loan and started the life-changing project that will see her and her family become empowered with cleaner, cheaper, and more efficient fuel. This will also save her one day in her weekends to rest and be with her children. The biogas will also supply her with light so she will not need to buy kerosene anymore. This will be good for her children who need to study in the evening and can now enjoy more study hours. We believe this will improve their grades. With the monthly income from tea and the sale of milk from her three cows, Lilian will be able to repay the loan, and once she clears she hopes to purchase a water tank to store rainwater and solve her water problem as well.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester

loans.name: Teing

texts.en:
Teing is 35 years old and married. She lives in a village located in the Phnom Proek district of Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is still in school and another one is too young for school. Her primary source of income is from the rice and corn plantation of a six-hectare farmland. She has been in this business for several years. 

She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000KHR to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for her farmland. This is the third loan for Teing with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she has completely paid back the previous loans. With this loan, she will be able to buy decent food for her family. She hopes to increase her crop yields and make a better life and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Seat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Ek Phnom district, Seat is 30 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a tailor, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver, to earn income to support their family. She has been in this business for several years. This is the second loan for Seat’s group of three members, and they successfully paid back the previous loan from VisionFund. 

The past loan helped Seat to provide her children with decent food. She can earn around 41,700 KHR per day from her current business. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fabrics for her business and to pay her family’s daily expenses. With this loan, she hopes to increase her tailoring business so as to increase her family’s income and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fabric for her business.

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en: Rat is aged 60 and is a villager from Battambang province's Moung Russey district.  She is married and has five children who have their own employment.  Rat grows rice on two hectares of farmland.  Having been in this business for 40 years, she is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day to support her expenses and can afford to save about 5,000 KHR per day.  This is the third loan cycle for Rat and the first-time for her one group member.  She has completely paid back the past loan to VisionFund.  The first loan has helped her improve her living conditions.  To support her current business, Rat and her group member are applying for a loan in total of 1,500,000 KHR.  As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland.  With this loan, she hopes to grow healthy rice and hopes to increase her rice yields so she is able to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of Khashuri district. Irma is pregnant. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have land where maize and haricot are grown. They work hard and always have high-quality products that are sold to local retailers. Irma decided to start an additional business and requested a loan for it. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,200 GEL and purchase a cow. They have a shed for the cow in their yard. Irma and her mother-in-law will milk the cow every day and will produce cheese to sell. The start-up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana is 32 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for four years. Ioana has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, brush, rollers, material, and elei carved designs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, brush, rollers, material, and elei carved designs

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is 20 years old and single with 1 child. She wants to start a small business of making and selling cooked food such as taro, fried chicken and so on in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a box of chicken, bags of flour, onions, oil, foam plates and foil. In the future, Christina hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, bags of flour, onions, oil, foam plates and foil.

loans.name: Losa

texts.en: Losa is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She wants to start a small business of making and selling German buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour and sugar, oil, yeast and a frying pan. In the future, Losa hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, oil, yeast and a frying pan.

loans.name: Ingrid Ivonne

texts.es: Ingrid de 24 años de edad, habita junto a su familia conformada por su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Es una mujer muy responsable con su hogar. Su compañero de vida trabaja como jornalero en una finca cerca donde vive, y juntos pagan sus gastos familiares. Ingrid tiene un deseo de encementar el piso donde vive, ya que tiene un corredor de tierra por salud e higiene por su hijo desea realizar esta mejora. Es por esa razón que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena y otros materiales de construcción que necesite. Confía en que pronto podrá realizar ese sueño y agradece la oportunidad que se le ha otorgado.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 24 years years old. She lives with her family which consists of her husband and a young son. She is a very responsible woman toward her household. Her life partner works as day labor on a farm close to where they live and together they pay the household expenses. Ingrid wants to finish the floor where they live in cement, as there is now a packed-earth corridor. She would like to make this improvement for the health and hygiene of her son.

For this reason Ingrid is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and other construction material that she needs. She hopes to be able to realize this goal and is grateful for the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy cement and construction materials that she needs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a very hardworking lady from Nakuru. She is 37 years old, married to Cyrus who produces additional income for the family, and has one teenage child aged 16 years old and in school.

She has a business of selling timber which she has been running for the last three years. To enable her to dedicate more time to her business, she has applied for her third loan of Kshs 30,000 from Kadet Ltd. which will be used to buy a gas cooker for use in preparation of meals for her family without wasting time, so as to create more time to be spent in her business.

Her monthly income at present is about Kshs 30,000 and she hopes that in the future she will have a fulfilled life.

loans.use: To buy a cooker for use in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish net, crab traps, and lead weights

loans.name: Duterintambwe I Group

texts.fr:
Alice fait parti du groupe DuterintambweI et habite à Gitega. Elle  a 28 ans et est mariée à  Pasteur, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 4 mois  à 10 ans, dont 3 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de la  bière depuis 4 ans.

Elle est à son huitième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’elle obtient, elle va augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de régime de bananes pour la transformation en bière de banane, à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Alice is part of the Duterintambwe I group, and lives in Gitega. She is 28 years of age and is married to Pasteur, a retailer. Together they have four children between the ages of 4 months and 10 years, three of whom are at school. 

Alice has worked selling banana beer for four years, and is on her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she plans to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, which she will use to make banana beer to sell and increase her income. Over the coming years, Alice would like to see her children go to school.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, which she will use to make banana beer to sell and increase her income

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old and married with four children, ages 8 to 14, who all attend primary school. He lives in Kyotera town with his family. 
Peter is a businessman who operates a bar. He supplements his family income with a monthly salary.
Peter works 18-hour days seven days a week. He has been in this business since 1990. He started it with the aim of earning a living because at the time he started this bar, he had no job.
He has acquired this loan to boost his business by restocking all the desired drinks for his customers. His main customers are local residents from his area.
His dream is to improve his standard of living by constructing a modern home for his family and to be able to provide daily bread for them.
His greatest challenge is lack of enough capital. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To buy drinks for his pub

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated a rental house business.  She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to buy cement to renovate two rooms for her business continuity. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy cement to renovate two rooms for her business continuity.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty lives in Likoni, Kenya. She is 30 years of age and she is married with three children. All her three children attend school. She has been in the business of selling clothing for more than five years, and this business is the sole income earner for her. She knew about Milango through a friend and advertisements, and now she seeks a loan to buy five bales of secondhand clothes to sell. The major challenge in her business is the competition from other traders. The extra income she will raise will help her educate her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy five bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a resident of Malindi, Kenya.  He is a 32 year-old married businessman with four children.  He runs a motorcycle transport business that has been in business for the last three years.  When not ferrying people from one point to another, he is farming.  The business has been doing fine and now he seeks a loan to buy a motorbike.  He knew Milango through friends and he decided to join so that he could access credit to fund the business.  The challenge for the business is the weather. During the rainy season most people do not prefer motorcycles.  The extra income that he raises will improve his standard of living and allow him to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana knows challenges and will never be afraid to face them. While everyone told her she is out to fail with her project, she kept working harder and harder until she proved them wrong.

Rana is a 35 years old Iraqi woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Five years ago her husband was paralyzed and since then she is the sole provider for the family. Facing a tough situation others might not have been able to handle, Rana took matters into her own hand.

Using the small land they had, she had a store built which was gradually filled with various goods. With great intuition about supply and demand, she purchased items for retail her customers could only buy in different towns before. With 5 years experience and a well built reputation, she is now able to attract many customers and carry many items from basic household goods to clothing and accessories for every member of the family.

Her growing business qualifies for the WLIFT program as Rana is taking a SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount 12,500 USD. Rana plans to use the loan to improve the current store and also to add small electrical appliances to her current stock.

Rana is confident, and her strong personality and persistence to succeed will surely help her succeed  She is not only growing into a respected local business woman but also is a great role-model for success to her children and other women in her area. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the current store and also to add small electrical appliances to her current stock.

loans.name: Lavalenesi

texts.en: Lavalenesi is 41 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for six years. Lavalenesi has requested a loan to  buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and Chinese candy. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lavalenesi will help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, foam cups, large spoons, and Chinese candy

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
La señora Lilia tiene 35 años, está en pareja con el señor Francisco, tienen 2 hijos aun pequeños, ella es comerciante, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida en la ciudad de Ita.
Allí provee a vecinos y amigos de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar como carne, verduras, leche, carbón, bebidas en general, embutidos y otros productos, mientras que su marido Francisco tiene una panadería también en la ciudad de Itá hace varios años.
La señora Lilia solicita el préstamo para la compra de diversos tipos  de insumos para la despensa a modo de aumentar su stock de mercaderías y pueda generar mayores ventas y por ende más ganancias, como ser verduras, comestibles en general, carnes, y demás. Ella agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida y se compromete a abonar sus cuotas en fecha ya que en el futuro desea agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Lilia is 35 years old and in a common-law partnership with Sr. Francisco.  They have two small children.  

Lilia is a merchant who manages a well-stocked food pantry in the city of Ita.  She provides her neighbors and friends with all types of basic household necessities such as meat, vegetables, milk, charcoal, beverages, sausages, and other products.  Meanwhile, her husband Francisco has managed a bakery in the city of Ita for several years.  

Sra. Lilia is requesting this loan so that she can buy different types of products for her food pantry.  This will enable her to increase her stock of merchandise and generate more sales and profits.  She plans to buy vegetables, general food products, meats, and other items.  Lilia is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she has received, so she commits to submitting her payments on time.  She would like to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, general food products, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es: Roberto Carlos de 35 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres y sus hermanos. Es un hombre trabajador y visionario que desea darle lo mejor a sus padres. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido construyendo su hogar le ha costado pero lo ha logrado, y desea con muchas ansías poder tener luz eléctrica propia pero no tiene los recursos suficientes para la realización de esta es por eso que solicito a FUSAI un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción como  cable y conexiones eléctricas y caja térmica. Su forma de ganarse la vida es como jornalero y cultiva semillas, granos básicos etc. Y luego los vende es así como asegura el pago de dicho credito
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is 35 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. He is a hardworking, forward looking man who wishes to do the best he can for his parents. With great effort and dedication he has managed to build a home; it was difficult but he did it. 

He wishes to be able to install electric lights but he doesn’t have enough money so he is seeking a loan form FUSAI to buy construction materials such as cable, electrical connections, and electrical box. Roberto Carlos earns his living as a labourer and plants seeds so he can grow basic grains. By selling them he will be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy construction materials such as cable, electrical connections, and electrical box

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She has a business of selling vegetables in Naivasha which she has operated for 25 years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her buy vegetables for sale. With anticipated profits, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to be the biggest tomato supplier in Naivasha market.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy floaters, nylon and fish net

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 60 years old, married and has five children.  

Lolita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lolita has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lolita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with no children. She lives at her own house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Mwanarusi has operated a beauty salon business for the past four years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Kimwana

texts.en:
Kimwana is married with seven children.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Kimwana has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors. 

Kimwana is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost so she can  improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.
 
The previous loan enabled her to to save money to renovate her family house. However, she still operates the motorcycle business. She is requesting a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is a youth client 25 years of age, single and he lives with his two brothers.
Ali owns a small shop where he sells mobile phones and accessories. He also specializes in repairing mobile devices and has mastered what he practices. Ali established his business in 2011 and has been in this field for almost nine years. Ali has good experience in what he practices and has become well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.
