Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a specialized piece of equipment used to repair mobile phones. Ali is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide more services for his society and a bright future for himself.

loans.use: to buy a specialized piece of equipment used to repair mobile phones

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy herself 10 dozen outfits for boys, and 12 dozen outfits for girls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy herself 15 boxes of tomatoes, 1 20L can of oil to resell retail, 1 bag of gumbo etc.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, a villager from Battambang province, strives for a living by rice farming on two hectares of land and by tailoring clothes. She is 34 years old and has three children to take care of. Her business, which she has had for 12 years, has enabled her to generate almost 32,000 KHR per day. With this new loan, Mom will be a fifth-time borrower whereas her co-borrower will be a six-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of Mom's past loans has enabled her to repay her loans and to support her living better than before, especially in purchasing household appliances and three meals a day for her family. Now, Mom leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR while her fellow group member is seeking 800,000 KHR. As the leader, Mom will spend her loan portion to pay a reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for replanting her crop. Mom hopes that she can gain a good crop output and keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: to pay a reaping fee and to buy fertilizer for replanting her crop.

loans.name: Yoeurt

texts.en:
A resident from Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Yoeurt is 44 years old and a married mother of four children. Currently, she needs to take care of only three children, as they are in school. To cover the daily cost of living, she does paddy rice farming on a two-hectare area and also sells grocery items for supplementary income. She has been with this business since she was 29 years old. 

She is a first-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The requested amount of this loan is 4,000,000 KHR. Yoeurt will spend this loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes to replenish this business on time so that she can continue to earn a good profit for her family, which has enabled her to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Perpetual Waithira

texts.en:
Perpetual is a member of a group called Thirwa in Central Kenya. She is a farmer and a business lady operating a small shop next to her house. She joined VEP in 2012, and since that time she has been able to benefit from renewable energy, having bought her first solar lamp and cleared her debt. Happily, she shares with us how much she has enjoyed life while using a solar lantern that helped her save at least 50% of the money she previously used on kerosene. The lamp she bought could be used in the sitting room for her children to study, during dinner and for the master bedroom. She would then only need to buy a little kerosene for her kitchen lantern, which the children would also use in their bedroom. 

For this loan, she would like to take a solar package that comes with four lights so she can have light in every room, charge mobile phones and power their small radio. The other older lamp can then be used in the shop to serve the evening customers instead of using a candle. This way she can open her shop for longer hours. With the package she will not have to buy kerosene anymore or pay to have her phone charged. This means a lot of savings for her and convenience for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Henry is a resident of the Mombasa Changamwe area, Kenya. He is a 37-year-old married businessman with two children. He runs a motorcycle transport business that has been operating for the last four years. The business has really grown and he has been able to employ two young people to run the business for him. This business is the sole income earner for him and now he seeks to increase his income and seeks a loan to buy another motorbike. In the next five years he wants the business to grow, and he hopefully wants to run a light transport business. He knew Milango through a friend and he joined so as to access credit for his business. The challenge for the business is weather. Extra income will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PRIMAVERA” iniciará el vigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elsa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de faldas, venta de chompas, venta de papa y chuño, cerrajería, venta de verduras, venta de papa, venta de busos, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elsa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de faldas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga quien le enseño a realizar la costura de faldas, posteriormente decide establecer su propio taller y su espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, los créditos y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Primavera” (Spring) is in its 26th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Elsa is the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as selling skirts, selling sweaters, selling regular and freeze-dried potatoes, performing metal work, selling vegetables, selling potatoes, selling sweatshirts, and selling jackets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Elsa.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Elsa currently has a business of selling skirts.  She became familiar with this business after a friend taught her how to manufacture skirts.  Eventually she decided to establish her own workshop and retail space.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric.  She will acquire her materials in bulk at the traditional fairs and then use them to make her products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to sustain her family.  Elsa is single and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Elsa said that she enjoys the savings, the loans, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making skirts.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN FRANCISCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Viviana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, producción de chompas, producción de tejidos, empresa de textiles, venta de frutas, venta y producción de mantas, venta de verduras, taller de costura, flete de triciclo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Viviana es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de frutas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años al estar apoyando a su hermana que tienen el mismo negocio, posteriormente cuando tuvo su pareja decide establecer su propio espacio de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área el ahorro.
texts.en:
The SAN FRANCISCO Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Regional Center. It is composed of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Sra. Viviana is president. The members of the communal bank run a variety of business including vegetable sales, the production of sweaters, the production of woven goods, a textiles business, fruit sales, the sale and production of blankets, vegetable sales, a sewing workshop, tricycle freight.

The loan that the members take out will benefit their small businesses. Sra. Viviana is a member and she notes that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago. She became a member at the invitation of a Pro Mujer advisor who came to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling fruit. She states that she learned this trade several years ago when she was helping her sister who has the same kind of business. Afterwards, when she had a partner, she decided to establish her own business space.

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to purchase fruit. She will get the fruit wholesale at traditional fairs and later will sell it at her sales stall. This kind of business enables her to generate funds to support her family since she lives in a common law relationship and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she enjoys the subject of savings.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Villa Adela Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGELES DE VILLA ADELA II”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, costura de chompas, costura de polleras, venta de miel, venta de ovejas, venta de víveres, ayudante de nimibus, venta de vajillas, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando cuando vino a visitar al Centro Focal y averiguar a cerca de los servicios que se realizan. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, al aprender  la técnica de costura de sus primos que tienen el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los servicios crediticios que tenemos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Angeles de Villa Adela II is starting its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Villa Adela regional office. It comprises nine members and Juana is the President of its governing board. The members of this communal bank run a variety of businesses, including: selling food, sewing sweaters, sewing skirts, selling honey, selling sheep, selling provisions, bus assistant, selling dishes, a car repair shop.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs in Juana's group. She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one year. She joined when she came to visit the regional office to find out about the services they provide. She currently has a business sewing skirts. She started her business several years ago when she learned the sewing skills from her cousins, who are in the same business.
 
She will use the loan she is taking out now to increase capital by purchasing fabric, which she will buy from the wholesale shops in the city of El Alto. After finishing her products she will sell them to order. This work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible, since she is married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us she likes the lending services we provide.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 43 years old from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with one child who is eight years old. He has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store business for a year now. He sell candies, chips, cooking oil, shampoo, detergent, and canned goods. He is asking for a loan to pay for boat repair and for the tuition fee for his child. His income provides food for his family and his daughter's education.

Danilo hopes that in the coming years he will be able to continually support his child’s schooling until she graduates from college.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo, and seasoning

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is 27 years old, married with two children ages three and five. Marilyn has helped her husband in their fishing business for three years now. She also farms bananas for additional income. She would like to be ahead and not to worry on their fishing inputs. With this, she is asking for a loan to buy weight leads, fish net and nylon.

This will help so they can catch more fish. She hopes that in the future they can have other businesses and will become successful in educating their children.

loans.use: to buy weight leads, fish net and nylon

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FE”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de chamarras, albañil, venta de verduras, macramé de mantas, venta de detergentes, carpintería, portera de escuela.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas; este negocio lo emprendió recientemente al empezar a convivir con su pareja, decide seguir este negocio porque anteriormente ayudaba a su madre a la venta de producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The community association, "FE" (Faith) is entering its third business cycle with Pro Mujer and the Pan-American Focus Center. The group is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which María Elena is the President. The group members make a living in various trades, including: blanket weaving, masonry, vegetable sales, detergent sales, carpentry, work as a school janitor, etc. 

The support from this loan will benefit the small business owners in this group, including María Elena, who joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who was already a member. María Elena operates a small business selling "salchipapas," a popular meat and fried potato dish. She started this business recently in order to cover important living expenses and support her son. María Elena learned the trade from her mother who also operated a food sales business. 

With the support from this loan, María Elena plans to purchase meat in bulk to stock her business. She buys her meat from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then cooks and prepares it at her food stand. She hopes that this investment will help strengthen her business and allow her to support her son and her husband's family with whom she lives. María Elena's favorite aspects of being a member of Pro Mujer are the training sessions she receives in financial and medical wellbeing.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk to stock her food sales business.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas de 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos de 12 años, 10 años y 5 años; Siendo un hombre admirad por su familia y amigos se siente orgulloso de si mismo y su familia. El trabaja como jornalero en una finca cerca de su hogar. Es así como honradamente se gana la vida decentemente. Tomas desea cambiar el techo de donde vive ya que tiene 50 años de vivir en su casa que es propia por el tiempo ya se está dañando es por eso que desea reparar todo el techo de su vivienda y se acercó a FUSAI para la compra de materiales de construcción como lamina galvanizada, polines. Cuenta con buenas referencias de pago
texts.en:
Tomas is 56 years old and lives with his wife, and his children ages 12, 10, and 5. As he is a man admired by his family and friends, he feels proud of himself and his family. He works as a day laborer on a farm near his home. This is how he earns a decent and honest living. 

Tomas wishes to replace the roof on the home where he lives, as he has been living in it for 50 years and it belongs to him.  With time it is getting to be in poor repair, and that is why he wishes to do a complete repair of his roof.  

He has approached FUSAI so that he can purchase construction materials such as sheet metal roofing, and studs. He has good payment references.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as sheet metal roofing for repairing his roof.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu operates a charcoal-selling business, She sells from home to her neighbors and she faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of incorporating firewood into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase six sacks of charcoal  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support and she appreciates the support granted.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa has operated a clothes selling business, which she sells at the market to her town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Solidarite Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABOU  est responsable du groupe SOLIDARITE. Elle se porte ainsi que tout le groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 11ans et le moins âgé a 08ans. Les 02 vont à l’école.
Mme vend divers marchandises (friperie, sel, savon liquide) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier pour les friperies et chez les grossistes pour le sel. Ses clients sont  les femmes et  les voisins.
Elle veut s’acheter 05kg de pâte qui est utiliser pour la fabrication du savon, 03sacs de sel et des drats de lit friperie.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte pour épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne toujours devenir un grossiste et acquérir une moto.
texts.en:
Ms. ZENABOU is the official of the group SOLIDARITE. She is well, as is the whole group. She is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 11 years old, and the youngest is 8. The two are going to school. 

Ms. ZENABOU has been selling a variety of merchandise (used clothing, salt, liquid soap) for four years. She gets her supplies of used clothing at her neighborhood market and of salt from wholesalers. Her customers are women and neighbors. She wants to purchase 5 kg of pâte used for making soap, 3 bags of salt, and some secondhand bedsheets.

She wants to open an account for saving her profits. Her ambition is still to become a wholesaler and to acquire a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase pâte used to make soap, salt, and bedsheets

loans.name: Lenh's Group

texts.en: Lenh is 58 years old and a widowed mother blessed with three children. For her family, rice farming and clothes tailoring are the main income sources, which have earned her almost 21,000 KHR per day. Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy necessary materials to build a proper latrine for her family. She hopes that her kids will have good health because of hygienic practices.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Chanra's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager located in Battambang province, Chanra is a young married mother of two children. Both her son and her daughter are too young for school. To provide for her family, she has been into rice growing on 1.5-hectares of her farmland as her main source of income, and she is able to earn about 46,100 KHR per day. She has been involved with this current business for 6 years. 

Chanra and two of her group members have never been with VisionFund before. Now she leads her group to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make good income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village located in the Ou Reang Ov district, Savy is a 56-year-old widow with two children. The main sources of her income are farming rice and selling groceries, which she has done for 38 years. With her business, her main challenge has been her low income. 

Savy is in her second loan cycle. She leads a group consisting of three members to apply a loan from  Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Savy has successfully repaid her past loan, which helped her make a good living. Now she is able to earn a daily income of about 25,800 KHR. As the leader of this group, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and grocery items for her grocery store. She hopes to make a good income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
This is Vjollca, an Egyptian Albanian mother of three from northern Albania.  She lives in a town where the national hero’s tomb, Skanderbeg, is located.  There are not very many members of the Egyptian community in this city, just a few including Vjollca.  Like a majority of the members in her community, she has been suffering from health issues caused by unhealthy living conditions most of her life.  However, she is receiving a disability income.  Vjollca has been an active borrower from our institution since the very beginning, dating back to 2001.  Here is what she stated during her interview: “without the loans and this institution, it would have been very difficult for me and my family; and for this I am very grateful.”
Vjollca needs your help to repair the leaking ceiling shown in the picture.

loans.use: to repair the leaking ceiling in her family's home.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married, with four children.  Two attend school; one is too young, and one is an adult. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling "leso" cloth (a wrap for women).  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KSH 20,000, she wants to purchase 30 pieces of leso cloth for resale. She decided to join Yehu to obtain loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pieces of 'leso’ cloth for resale

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale. 

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and to earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu Microfinance Trust for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en:
Abdul Latif is 37 years old and a responsible father of 2 sons and 5 daughters. He is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He is a milk man by profession. He has seven buffaloes for getting milk, a bull for breeding and many bull and heifer calves. He gets milk two times a day. His wife and daughters produce cheese, yogurt and butter from the milk. With the addition of these products he earns sufficient income to run a house. 

He has been keeping his cattle at home, and through breeding he has been increasing his number of cattle for many years, but now he does not have enough space at home to keep cattle. He is feeling a problem during getting milk and feeding his cattle in the congested atmosphere. He has an empty wide space beside his house, but does not have a sufficient amount of money to build a cowshed for his cattle. 

Therefore, Abdul Latif requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could build a cowshed and more easily increase his cattle. He hopes that now he will be able to easily carry on his business, and he would not be in any need of more space for cattle for many years. 

Abdul Latif has to pay for the marriage of his dear daughters, and he has to collect the dowry as well. He has to maximize his savings so that he could easily fulfill his responsibilities. He says thanks to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to construct a cow shed.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel lives in the Changamwe area in Kenya. He is a 29-year-old, married businessman, with one child. 

For ten years now, Samuel has been running an electronics shop. The business has been growing and he has employed someone to help him run the business. Samuel hopes that the business will grow big enough for him to be able to supply electronic goods in the next five years. The major challenge in this business is capital and sometimes he runs out of stock. 

Samuel knew Milango Financial Services through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy general electronics and mobile phone accessories. The extra income will be used to educate his child and to improve his current business.

loans.use: to buy general electronics and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en: Makvala is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in the Mukhrani district with her husband and son. Her husband is a carpenter and gets 250 Gel per month. Makvala has a poultry business. She has hens and sells eggs to local retailers. Makvala decided to expand her agricultural activities and to purchase calves. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 2000 Gel for purchasing calves. Makvala will raise them and will produce dairy products to sell in future. This will increase the income of her family and she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Gerald Jose

texts.es: Gerald, es un joven que habita en casa de su madre en una zona donde los pobladores son de muy escasos recursos, es casado tiene un hijo de 9 meses de nacido, Gerald tiene un pequeño negocio de pulpería con el que mantiene los gastos de su hogar. El solicita el crédito para invertirle productos básicos de la necesidad de sus clientes quienes son los vecinos del barrio, comprara granos básicos, pollo, carne, aceite, lácteos, embutidos. De esta manera continuara apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Gerald is a young man who lives in his mother's home in an area where residents have very limited resources. He is married and has a nine-month-old child.

Gerald has a small business, a grocery store that allows him to cover his household expenses. He is requesting this loan in order to invest in the basic products needed by his customers, who are the people in his neighborhood. He will purchase basic grains, chicken, meat, oil, dairy products, and cold cuts. This will allow him to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, oil, dairy products, and cold cuts.

loans.name: Victor  Manuel

texts.es: Don Víctor de 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa  y sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, él se dedica a la agricultura  desde hace 15 años siembra maíz y frijol, es una persona trabajadora y dedicada a sus labores, con lo que obtiene de sus ingresos logra solventar algunos de las necesidades de su familia, Víctor esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícola como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, herbicidas, etc. con esto espera brindarle a su familia una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Víctor, who is 56 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and two kids of 15 and 12 years old. They are currently going to school. He has been working in agriculture for 15 years planting corn and beans. He is hardworking and dedicated to his work. With what he gets from his income, he will be able to straighten out some needs in his family. Víctor is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc. With this, he hopes to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, etc..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hooks and fish net and to pay for labor on his house renovation

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 48 years old and is married. He is blessed with three children, ages 19, 17 and 6 years old. He has an educational academy in Nairobi town. He has run it for 14 years. 

He plans to use this loan amount to buy school desks and lockers, and also plans to develop the academy by renovating and building more classrooms. This is his 3rd loan term and he paid his previous loans successfully. 

Stanley hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy school desks and lockers.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is asking for a new loan because she believes that with it, she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money to operate a food-cooking business. She cooks beans and chapati (flat bread). However, she still operates the cashew nut-selling business. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, and beans.

loans.name: Jhoanna Smith

texts.es:
Jhoanna es una joven de 20 años, que vive en la ciudad de Imperial. –Johanna desde muy joven tuvo al necesidad de trabajar, ya que su familia no tenía muchos ingresos económicos. Dia a dia Johanna trabaja como obrera en un fundo agrícola en un fundo de su ciudad, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su humilde trabajo saca adelante con mucho esfuerzo a su pequeño hijo de 8 años de edad; Jhoanna cree que está saliendo adelante porque tiene la mejor motivación que alguien puede tener, el cual es su hijo.

Jhoanna está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar mas conejos y materiales para la construcción de jaulas, ya que actualmente ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de cuyes y conejos, de esta manera podrá mejorar su negocio y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de contabilidad y darle una profesión a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a young woman who is 20 years of age and lives in the city of Imperial.  She needed to work at a very young age because her family did not have a lot of financial resources.  Day after day, Jhoanna works as a laborer on a farm in her town.  She works approximately eight hours a day and the fruits of her humble work have enabled her to get ahead with great effort along with her eight-year-old son.  Jhoanna believes she is moving forward because she has the best motivation that anyone could have, which is her son.  

She is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to buy more rabbits and materials for building cages.  At the moment, Jhoanna has started a small business of selling guinea pigs and rabbits.  This loan will enable her to improve her business and increase her earnings.  She continues to strive toward fulfilling her greatest dream of studying for a degree in accounting and helping her son pursue a profession.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and materials for building cages.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Likoni, Kenya. He is a 37-year-old married businessman with five children. Four of his children attend school. He has been in the quarrying and block making business for the last seven years, and the business has been growing despite the usual challenges with lack of transportation and high fuel costs.  

He knew about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy more work tools and be able to employ people to work at his site. The extra income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living and he will also keep his children in school. He hopes that in the future he will own a vehicle to transport blocks to the clients' place of work.

loans.use: to buy more work tools.

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
Romik is from Metsamor vilage, where he lives with his parents, his wife, and two daughters. 

Since 1995 Romik has provided repair service to locals. In particular, he repairs phones aand other electrical equipment. He is already very skilled at his job, and locals value his hard and good quality work very much. His business helps Romik to sustain his family's standard of living.

Now for purchasing tools and equipments to help him in his work, Romik needs financial support. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So this loan will greatly assist Romik to have tools and equipment that will make his work effective.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing repair service

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 48 años de edad, tiene 6 años de vivir en la ciudad. Su familia tiene sus orígenes en la zona rural, por lo que le fue muy difícil estudiar y solo completo hasta el sexto grado. Se casó y tuvo 5 hijos, 3 varones y dos hembras, que aún viven con ella. Su esposo por necesidad emigro a Estados Unidos y vive en dicho país desde hace 6 años. 
María tiene aproximadamente 4 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de arreglos florales con materiales reciclados, actividad que aprendió viendo una exposición en la capital del país, le llamo mucho la atención y desde entonces ha perfeccionado la técnica y tambien a la venta de cosmeticos, ropa y perfumeria.

El préstamo será utilizado, para la compra de cosméticos, perfumería  y ropa para dama. La compra de estos productos se realizara en la capital del país   ubicado a  2 horas en autobús  desde donde vive, esta inversión  incrementará sus ventas  al tener diversidad de productos  y le dará mayores ganancias que  le servirá  para salir adelante  con sus hijas.
Tiene como meta personal, montar un taller de floristería artificial  y utilizando materiales reciclados para su elaboración, así podrá darles a sus hijas la oportunidad de realizar estudios superiores.
texts.en:
María, 48, has lived in the city for six years.  Her family's from a rural area, so it was very hard for her to go to school, and she only completed up to sixth grade.  She got married and had five children, three males and two females; her daughters still live with her.  Her husband had to emigrate to the United States, where he has lived for six years.

María has been making floral arrangements with recycled materials for approximately four years.  She learned this job when she saw a display in the capital of her country.  It caught her attention and since then she has perfected her technique. She also sells cosmetics, clothing, and perfume.

She'll use the loan to buy cosmetics, perfume, and women's clothing.  She'll make her purchases in the capital, located two hours away by bus from where she lives.  This investment will increase her sales because of the variety of products, giving her more income to get ahead with her daughters.

María's personal goal is to set up a workshop and use recycled materials to make artificial flowers.  This way she'll be able to give her daughters the opportunity to get a college education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfume, and women's clothing

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 57 years old and lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She has been in the fruits business for more than ten years, and the business has been feeding her family. This is the sole income earner for her and the family. She is a divorced mother of two adult children who are on their own now. She hopes that her business will grow to be a stable grocery in the next five years, despite the usual challenges of capital shortage and the seasons. 

She knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy bananas, oranges and mangoes for her business. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges and mangoes.

loans.name: Regina Yaneht

texts.es:
Doña Regina es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella es casada, agricultora y ama de casa la cual es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales el mayor está en secundaria y los 3 menores en primaria. Ella junto a su esposo se han dedicado a la agricultura por mucho tiempo ya que es el medio de ingreso más fuerte para fortalecer la economía de su hogar. También tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual mantiene productos básicos de consumo como refrescos botella desechables, arroz, maíz, frijoles, leche entre otros que ayudan a contribuir mediante su venta los ingresos para su familia y de la misma forma re invertir en la misma. Ella aprendió el rubro de la agricultura desde muy temprana edad inculcada por sus padres quienes son agricultores desde toda una vida y por generaciones. La tierra que su familia trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres y otra parte comprada la cual está ubicada cerca de su casa a la cual se trasladan a pie. 

Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir ampliando más sus tierras ya que de esa manera ella podrá cultivar una mayor y mejor variedad de café más resistente a las enfermedades como la roya y a bichos y plagas que deterioren la cosecha. Como madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, darles la oportunidad y apoyo para que ellos puedan ir a la universidad y puedan graduarse. Por los que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, foliares, formula cafetalera, fungicidas e insecticidas para asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Regina is a 41 year old woman. She’s married, a farmer, and a housewife. She has four children; the oldest is in high school, and the younger three are in elementary school. 

She’s been working in agriculture along with her husband for a long time since it’s the best way to secure the family’s finances. She also has a small grocery store with basic goods like sodas in disposable bottles, rice, corn, beans, milk, etc. The sale of these products helps to contribute and reinvest in the family’s finances. 

She learned the business of agriculture at a very early age from her family who were farmers for their whole lives and through the generations. The land that her family works is hers thanks a parcel inherited from her parents and another parcel that she purchased which is close to her house and which they can walk to. 

Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her land since, that way, she’ll be able to grow more and a better variety of coffee which is more resistant to diseases like blights, bugs, and pests that damage the crops. 

As a mother she supports her children in their studies, giving them opportunity and support so that they can go to college and graduate. 

Today she’s asking for a loan from COMIXMUL to buy agricultural supplies like manure, fertilizer that is absorbed through the leaves, specialized coffee fertilizer, fungicides, and insecticides to help her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support her coffee crop.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para colocar variedad de mercadería; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar carnes, huesos, chorizos, entre otros. 
El crédito anterior le permitió mantener el negocio y sus ventas son bastante estables; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado. Su deseo es agregar otro tipo de rubro y ampliar su vivienda, asimismo sacar adelante su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda needs to take out another loan to buy a variety of merchandise. This investment will help her buy meat, bones, sausages and more. 

The previous loan allowed her to maintain her business and her sales are very stable. Her financial condition and family circumstances have improved. She wants to add another activity and make her house bigger as well as get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy meat, bones, sausages and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his degree expenses.

loans.name: Menay

texts.en: Menay is 35 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County. She is unmarried and has three children between the ages of 5 to 16; all of them attend school. For the past two years she has been operating a table where she sells vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, etc. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she make a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, and other items to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more vita, oil, rice, onion, rice, salt, and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan  de 39 años de edad, estudio segundo grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y a cuidar a los niños en casa, mientras don Juan sale al trabajo, ellos tienes 3 hijos que viven en su casa, de los 3 niños solo estudia la niña mayor que tiene 8 años tercer grado, además  en su vivienda vive la mamá de don Juan, en total  las personas que habitan en el hogar son 6 personas.

Él presta sus servicios de vigilancia, desde hace 3 años y su lugar de trabajo es un banco, ubicado a distancia de su casa de 10 kilómetros y para transportarse caminar un kilómetro para abordar el autobús. Aprendió este trabajo porque ya había prestado su servicio militar y esto le facilito mas  poder aprender del trabajo, el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM  a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para remodelar su vivienda, en la compra de materiales de construcción, le permitirá darles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, mamá e  hijos, estarán menos expuestos a adquirir enfermedades y a contaminantes y le permitirá salir de la vulnerabilidad de peligro que tiene su casa y estar en un lugar cómodo confiable y sobre todo seguro 

Su sueño, es tener una casa segura y digna,   para toda su familia y vivir mejor, que sus hijos sean mejores que él  profesionalmente y  que estudien una carrera  universitaria  cada uno de los 3 niños.

El préstamo le ayudara a satisfacer un necesidad que anhelaba, hace años de remodelar su casa que por fin siente que se le a hecho realidad el sueño de tener una mejor casa para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old. He went to school through the second grade and is married. His wife and his wife takes care of the home and the children while Juan works. They have 3 children at home, and only the oldest, and 8 year old girl, goes to school. She is in the third grade. Juan's mother also lives in their home. In total, there are are 6 people in the home.

He has been a security guard for 3 years and he works in a bank located 10 kilometers from his house. He walks a kilometer to take the bus. He learned this work because he had already done military service and this made it easier to learn the job. He works from 7:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

The loan he is asking for is to remodel his home by buying construction materials. This will allow him to give his wife, his mother and his children a better quality of life. They will be less exposed to getting sick and to pollutants and they will be less vulnerable to danger and be in a comfortable and above all safe place. 

His dream is to have a safe and worthy home for his whole family,to live better, and for all of his 3 children to have better jobs than him and to go to college. 

This loan will allow him to satisfy a need he has had for years and remodel his house. He thinks his dream of having a better house to live in with his family has finally become a reality.

loans.use: to remodel his house and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es: Doña Apolonia se encuentra muy feliz ya que con su primera solicitud de crédito ella pudo comprar los insumos para sus cultivos de papa con la que obtuvo una excelente producción 50 quintales los cuales vendió a muy buen precio y pudo salir con su compromiso de crédito. Las ganancias fueron muy buenas y re invirtió en sus cultivos una parte y la otra fue destinada para un semillero de papa certificado el cual pudo obtener esta vez para poder cultivar. Además ella pudo hacer una mejora en su casa de habitación construyendo una pared de ladrillo en su casa la cual era indispensable para poder hacer una división. Su negocio tuvo un cambio porque mejoro su producción gracias al primer financiamiento como también su calidad de vida ya que los ingresos obtenidos eran los esperados hasta tal punto que sobrepasaron sus expectativas. Por lo que esta vez han decidido solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual puedan sembrar la semilla que actualmente tienen en una mayor cantidad y poder preparar la tierra nuevamente para el nuevo producto ya que es necesario por el mantenimiento y protección de la misma para poder sacar buenos resultados.
texts.en: Apolonia is very happy because with her first loan request she was able to buy supplies for her corn crop.  She obtained a crop yield of 50 quintals which she sold at a very good price and was able to repay the loan.  Profits were very good and she reinvested part in her crops and the other was used to buy certified potato seed from a nursery which she was able to get to plant.  She was also able to do some home repairs building a brick wall at home that was indispensable in order to divide a room.  Her business changed because production improved thanks to the first loan.  So did her quality of life because income earned were as expected, they even surpassed her expectations in fact.  Therefore, this time she’s decided to request a second loan to plant the seeds she now has in larger amounts and to be able to prepare the soil once again for the new product because it’s necessary for crop maintenance and protection if results are to be good.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seed and to prepare the soil for planting.

loans.name: Khisrav

texts.ru: Хисрав уроженец города Куляб и начинающий бизнесмен. Ему 33 года. Он женатый человек и отец двух дочерей, которым по 5 и 3 года. Хисрав со своей семьей живет у родителей. В данный момент Хисрав собирается начать торговый бизнес. Его интересует торговля продуктов питания. Хисрав рядом со своим домом построил помещение для магазина и закупил одну витрину с холодильником и два морозильника. Теперь для открытия магазина ему необходимо закупить товар. С такой целью он обратился за кредитом. На запрашиваемую сумму Хисрав хочет купить ассортимент продуктов питания и начать торговлю. Именно с вашей поддержки он сможет открыть свой торговый бизнес.
texts.en: Khirsav is a native of the city Kulob and is a beginning businessman.  He is 33 years old, married, and the father of two daughters, who are 5 and 3 years old.  Khirsav and his family live with his parents.  Khirsav is preparing to start a commercial business, and is interested in selling food.  Khirsav built a room next to his home for his store and purchased a display case with a refrigerator and two freezers.  For the opening of his store he now needs to purchase products.  With this goal he asked for a loan.  With the requested amount, Khirsav wants to buy an assortment of food and start selling.  With your support he can open his own business.

loans.use: to purchase food for the opening of his store

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is 61 years old.  She is married to Peter and they are supporting five children.

Peres has a restaurant business in Naivasha which she has operated for 28 years.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy stock such as beans, flour, tomatoes, among other items. With the anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, Peres  hopes to buy a plot of land and build a house where she will be running a hotel.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years of age, married to Naserian and is a father of two young children. He is employed in the motorcycle transport business. He learned about KADET from other riders in the town. He has been in the business for the last three years with a monthly salary of KES 15,000.

Simon has acquired his first loan of KES 91,065, which will enable him buy his own motorcycle. This will enable him to make more income. He will use the proceeds to meet his family's basic needs. 

Simon hopes to own a car in the near future.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fish and shellfish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, onions, charcoal, beef, chicken, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti operates a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors.   In addition, she has a business of selling goods at retail to earn a living and support her family well.  She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. 

With this loan, Mwanasiti plans to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 47-year-old very industrious lady who supports a family of five members, including two of her grandchildren.  She learned about Kadet from a loan officer who was doing a marketing campaign in Narok town.

Esther runs a bookstore as well as supplies books and other studying materials to the schools within Narok town.  Her monthly income is approximately KES 150,000. She has acquired her first loan of KES 100,000 which will facilitate her buying books in bulk, especially as now when most of the schools are re-opening for their third term.

The increased proceeds will be used to develop her plot of land. Her dream is to be the major book supplier in the region.

loans.use: buy books to resell

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married with seven children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanakombo operates a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition, she also does a business selling cooked food.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a big restaurant in the near future. 

With this KSH 40,000 loan, Mwanakombo wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy cashews to sell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Phalla, 23, is married and lives with her husband and one child in a village in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who grow cassavas on 2 hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for three years, she is able to earn about 7,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Phalla’s group consists of two members who are both female. She is a third-cycle client while her co-member is a fifth-cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  

Phalla has successfully paid back her past loans, which have helped her relieve the financial burden for her family and improve their livelihood. Now she is requesting another loan with VisionFund. 

Phalla, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her cassava farm. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better off her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Pok is 23 years old and married with one son. To make a living, she has been farming rice and supplementing her income by working for others for a fee. She has been in agriculture business for 6 years. The current business earns her family about 27,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 

This is Pok's first cycle with VisionFund.  She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farm and use a portion of it to spend on labors. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: by fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sengleap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 44 years old, Sengleap is a widowed mother of two children living in a rural village in the Ou Reang Ov district, Cambodia. To support her family, Sengleap has been farming rice and washing motorbikes in the village. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Sengleap has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to better support her family and business. Now leading her group to ask for a new loan, Sengleap will use her portion to buy fertilizers and gasoline for her farm. She hopes to increase her crop yields and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and gasoline

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Kimchen's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Kimchan is a 56-year-old mother of two children. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice and raise cows to make a living. Together, they can earn about 16,000KHR per day from the current business and can manage to save about 8,000KHR each day.

Kimchen has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back the loans with VisionFund. The past loan has helped her better support her family. Now she and her group member are applying for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sokkeng

texts.en:
A married mother of five children living in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sokkeng is 58 years old and she makes a living by selling rice soup and coffee while her husband is a teacher. With 10 years of experience in this business, she is able to earn up to 15 USD per day and save 8 USD per day.

Sokkeng joins Kiva’s partner VisionFund this cycle as a second-time borrower. She is going to use this loan to spend on her son’s education, the tuition fee for the two years of her son’s Mathematics master degree program. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her son in tertiary education until graduation and also help relieve the financial burden for her family so that she can sustain and grow her business.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education fees

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 47-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the town of Talibon, Bohol. For five years now, she has been raising hogs for an income.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more piglets to raise and a calf that she can start to add to her stock for expansion. She knows that her income always provides food for her and her husband. 

Antonia hopes that with her hard work, everything will pay off and she can have savings in the future.

loans.use: to buy a calf and piglets

loans.name: Nhong

texts.en:
Residing in the Baray district of Kampong Thom province, Nhong is 60 years old and married. She has six children. She has struggled to make a living though farming rice and selling grocery items. She has engaged in this business for several. 
Nhong has been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her standard of living. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay for the school fee of her daughter. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue the degree so as to find a good job after graduation and also help her to relieve her financial burden.

loans.use: To pay for the school fee of her daughter

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 40-year-old single business lady. She is a mother of two children who fully depend on her. Esther has been selling second-hand clothes for the past six years with a monthly income of Ksh 8,000, which she uses for her family's upkeep. 

Esther is applying for her sixth loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy more clothes for resale. 

With the expected profit from the business, she will repay the loan and pay the school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a good home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is 43 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Nicholas, who is a businessman, and they have six children aged 24, 20, 18, 16, 12 and 7 years old.

She operates a business of selling fish and vegetables, and she has been doing this for the past 14 years. She has applied for her first loan of Kshs 20,000 from KADET Ltd so as to enable her to buy more stock for this business.

Her monthly income at present is Kshs 10,000, and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay the school fees for her children.

In the future, Pamela hopes to open more fish and vegetable stalls in her area.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of fish and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married, and his spouse is a housewife. He has one child, aged 2 years.

He sells potatoes at the local market, a business he has been running for the past three years.  To enable him to buy more stock of potatoes, he has applied for his second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd.

His monthly income right now is Kshs. 6,000.   His hope and dream for his future business and for his family is that he will be an established businessman in the whole of Nyahururu.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary who does not produce additional income for the family and he has two children aged 10 and 8 years old.

He is a potatoes vendor and he has been in this business for 13 years. He has applied for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which is his second, and he is going to use it for buying more stocks of potatoes to sell to his customers.

His intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business in buying more stocks of potatoes and he hopes that in future, he is going to be able to open his own store where he will stock potatoes for wholesale.

loans.use: To buy potatoes from farmers and later sell at the local market

loans.name: Capistrana

texts.en:
Capistrana is 35 years old from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 5, 7 and 13. Her husband works in the government. 

She is also engaged in farming rice and attending to her Sari-sari (variety)store business to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 8 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor, buy canned goods, soft drink and rice.   

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, pay for labor, buy canned goods, soft drinks and rice

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54 year old single mother and supports one child.

She has a business of selling vegetables in Naivasha which she has operated for eighteen years and has applied for first loan from Kadet ltd to enable her buy stock of vegetables such as tomatoes for re-sale. With anticipated profit she plans to pay school fees for her child as well as expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to open a kiosk where she will be running her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables such as tomatoes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is asking for a new loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business.

The previous loan enabled her to to save money to operate a coconut selling business. However, she still operates the retail shop. She is requesting for a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda is a resident of Caldwell.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are adults who are working.  For the past three years, Belinda has been selling dried goods such as rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers.  She started this business by selling cookies and bread. One thing she enjoys is that she is relaxed and her business is going fast.   She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers for her business.  She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase rice, peanuts, copy-books, candles and diapers for her business,

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en: Naveeda is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last four months. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 22 years old and a young father of two children, ages two months and a two years. He is a responsible father and husband who provides for his family through hog raising. This has been his business for a year now. He is asking for a loan to buy feed for his hogs. 

Arnold has big plans, like expanding his business someday and making a big piggery.  He is motivated to do this so that his children can have a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Brigitta

texts.en: Brigitta appreciates her previous Kiva loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Eli is 27 years old and from Nyahururu. He is not married, but he supports his parents. He is a farmer, as well as a trader of farm produce, a business he has been running for the past four years.

Eli has applied for his second loan of Kshs. 20,000 from Kadet Ltd which he hopes to use to buy sacks to transport farm produce, like potatoes, to the market.  The remaining money will be used for hiring laborers.

Eli's hopes and dreams for the future are to be a great farmer in his area, and to be the main supplier of farm produce in his village.

loans.use: To buy sacks to help transport farm produce to the market, and to hire laborers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water.

Esther has operated a coconut selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passerby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Riaz is a 43-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past five years, has been running a business selling cloth. Riaz buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Riaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.  Riaz expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is also helping her by purchasing things from market. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, grains and flour.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen is a 49-year-old married woman who has three children.  For about eight years she is been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way, she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with the packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecelia is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of three children ages two, three and a month old baby. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Cecelia has been in the hog raising business for a few years now. She is asking for a loan to buy a piglet, feed to maintain her hogs, nails and hard wood to renovate her house. In the future, Cecelia only dreams for the best of her children specially for them to have a good education through her hard work and the success of her business.

loans.use: to buy piglet, feed, nails and hard wood

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 31 years old, married to Mary, and supports a family of six.  His children are aged between twenty-six and seven years of age. He is a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last six years. His monthly income is KES 8000.

Jackson is currently servicing his 3rd loan from KADET of KES 30,000, which will help him to prepare his land and seedlings planted. He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare land and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is gratefull for the first loan he received from Kiva. He bought a planing machine with the loan and his work improved. The extra income he used to pay school fees for his children. He is seeking another loan to buy 2x2 pieces pieces of timber, 15 feet each, for his business. The challenge in the business is raising capital but he is grateful to Kiva for helping him out. In the next five years he wants to buy a piece of land and build a residential home for his family.

loans.use: to buy 2x2 pieces pieces of timber, 15 feet each

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Magaret is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, Magaret has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, Magaret wants to purchase bread, wheat flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, wheat flour, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband (who is also shown in the picture) at the corner of her house. They have been running it together for many years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Aysha is a mother of three children, and she is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for ten years. Her husband is a mason and does not earn enough money so she started her business to support her family. She stitches balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good quality footballs. She earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 30,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees). The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. She is hopeful to get an expansion in her business, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 34-year-old married woman and is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. Two years ago, she started her a small general store in her community.  She offers various goods such as hair accessories, creams and lotions, reels of threads etc. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Over the time she has become popular in her community for providing good quality products and makes enough to meet the expenses of her children. 

Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy packs of hair ponies and clips along with the stock of powder and lotions to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of hair ponies and clips along with the stock of powder and lotions.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has successfully run a small general store in her community with the support of her husband.  She offers various goods for daily use. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000, which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en: Ishrat, 50 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a shop keeping business for many years. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Ishrat needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. Ishrat has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.  In this way, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 54 years old, from Getafe, Bohol. She is married with three adult children.

For 15 years now, Claudia has been selling fish, while her husband work as a policeman.

Claudia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell and to buy a new weighing scale. This will help, so she can have a good sale, with the help of additional capital. She would like to continue saving for old age, so she will not have to depend on her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to buy a weighing scale.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim is a 49-year-old father of eight children, only one of whom is still in school. To make a living, he has been farming rice and cassava as his main sources of the family’s income. Lim has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle. With his current business, he is able to earn about 41,700 KHR per day to spend on daily expenses. Now he leads a group consisting of three members to request a loan from VisionFund. He will use his portion to buy fertilizer for his crops. With this loan, he hopes to grow more rice and cassava to increase his family’s income so as to improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sambou's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kandal province’s Ponhea Leur district, Sambou is aged 34 years and widowed. She has three children to take care of, and all of them are dependents and still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for three years. She currently earns about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Sambou is the first cycled client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 175,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine. She hopes to have a healthy latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a proper latrine

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and married to John.  They have two children, who are in school.

She has a retail shop in Naivasha that she has operated for five years.  She has applied for her first loan from Kadet Ltd to enable her to buy more stock, such as sugar, rice, and flour, among other items. 

With the anticipated profit, Nancy plans to pay school fees and expand her business.  In the near future, she hopes to own a wholesale shop in the Boma area.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and flour, among other items.

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.pt:
Vitoria nasceu na província de Inhambane, no Sul de Moçambique. Tem 29 anos, vive maritalmente na casa própria com a sua família, e é mãe de 4 filhos somente 2 é que vão a escola. Não responsabiliza-se  por ninguem.
É funcionária da empresa Beluzi Bananas (como agricultora) e aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da casa e da sua obra. está a construir uma casa para si e para sua familia. com o presente  empréstimo pretende para aumentar bens da casa, comprando uma cristaleira. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku para compra de bens o anterior foi para habitação.
 Futuramente pretende ver sua casa mobiliada e dar mais conforto a sua familia e por fim adquirir uma viatura.
texts.en:
Vitoria comes from the province of Inhambane, southern Mozambique. She's 29 years old and married. She lives with her family in a house that she owns. She has four children, only two of whom attend school. She doesn't have anybody under her responsibility.
She works for a banana company named Beluzi (as a farmer) and earns an income that she uses to pay for her household and construction expenses. She's building a house for herself and her family.
